column13: job_description
column14: job_description_html
column44: all

column13:
We are looking for proficient programmers to join our team to train our AI chatbots to code. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

As part of the application process, you will be asked to complete an assessment. If you pass, you will gain access to projects. Based on the quality of your work, you will continue to receive projects regularly. We find our most successful candidates work between 5-20 hours per week, up to 40 hours.

Benefits:

 * This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
 * You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
 * You can work on your own schedule
 * Projects are paid hourly, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities:

 * Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
 * Write high-quality answers and code snippets
 * Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications:

 * Fluency in English
 * Proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript
 * Detail-oriented
 * Excellent writing and grammar skills
 * A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)

Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you.

#INDUSSD

Job Type: Contract

Pay: From $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 1 – 40 per week

Work Location: Remote

Work from the Comfort of Your Home to Train AI. Apply Today. Get paid to train AI. Remote, flexible schedule. No Experience Required. Easy Withdrawals. Free Training. Flexible Hours.

', 'captions': None, 'id': 1048479, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/8605843/dataannotation-template-1714614139466.jpg'], 'title': 'About Us', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

Working for DataAnnotation is as simple as logging in and completing projects. We're proud to offer projects starting at $20 USD per hour, with higher hourly payments for high-quality work. The best part? The earnings are unlimited. If you qualify for our long-running projects and demonstrate high-quality work, there will be virtually unlimited work available to you. The more tasks you complete, the more you earn - it's as straightforward as that.

', 'captions': None, 'id': 1048480, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/8605843/dataannotation-template-1714614146013.jpg'], 'title': 'Earnings and Opportunities', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

At DataAnnotation, we understand that the traditional 9-to-5 work schedule doesn't work for everyone. Why should it, anyway? As our world becomes more connected, the way we work should evolve too. That's why we offer complete flexibility in our projects.

With DataAnnotation, your office is wherever you want it to be, and your work hours are whenever you want them to be. Choose your own hours and schedule every single day.

', 'captions': None, 'id': 1048481, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/8605843/dataannotation-template-1714614146830.jpg'], 'title': 'Flexibility is our Foundation', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

How much will I get paid?
Projects start at $20 USD per hour. Hourly rates increase depending on the project.\xa0

How flexible is the work?
You choose when to work, how much to work, and which projects you’d like to work on. Work is available 24/7/365.

How much work will be available to me?
If you qualify for our long-running projects and demonstrate high-quality work, there will be virtually unlimited work available to you.

What kind of data collection projects do you have?
Projects on the platform run the gamut: from survey-style work, to interacting with chatbots, to creative writing tasks, and much more. Additionally, some of our core projects allow you to take advantage of your areas of expertise or subjects that you are passionate about.

Who is this opportunity for?
While no specific background experience is necessary, we're seeking individuals who have excellent writing and critical reasoning abilities, are detail-oriented, creative, and self-motivated. Applicants are encouraged to hold a Bachelor's degree.\xa0

column13:
JOB SUMMARY


Spectrum’s Product and Technology team creates, develops, and operates the nation’s fastest mobile service, most reliable Internet service, most viewed live TV app, and the most advanced WiFi, serving millions of users and devices. We are transforming the next era of connectivity and entertainment experiences. Our goal in the Software Development Information Technology organization is to help Spectrum succeed by securely and rapidly delivering the best and most efficient technology in support of our business. We do this through a mix of delivery teams, operations functions, and corporate shared services like Architecture, End-to-End Test and Security. The Software Engineer I will work with technical teams to create software solutions that use prevailing technologies and improve the customers’ experience while adhering to business and technical requirements. Design and develop specific software subsystems under the guidance of senior software engineers.


MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Actively and consistently supports all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience.


Understand and code basic features, functions and definitions.


Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following established coding standards under the supervision of senior developers.


Implement pre-designed solutions as instructed by team lead following best practices and approved code patterns.


Implement basic functionality based on a provided design with team guidance.


Understand technical requirements and technical design documents.


Utilize code branching strategies and change control methodologies.


Code as per the Charter standards and guidelines.


Assist in fixes to defects raised.


Complete assigned tasks within a given timeframe.


Test and validate their own code. Submit code for code review and applies feedback.


Provide LOE on a capability level.


Collaborate with other teams, within a feature team, and/or a focus group.


Adhere to legal, regulatory, process, and security requirements of their organization.


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Required Skills/Abilities and Knowledge
Ability to read, write, speak and understand English
Basic knowledge of coding principles
Knowledge of one major programming language/tool
Knowledge of coding language and syntax, usage of functions and object-oriented patterns
Understanding of applicable technical systems and programming in a general sense
Ability to follow standard practices and procedures in analyzing situations or data from which answers can be readily obtained and work on problems of limited scope
Ability to apply company policies and procedures to resolve routine issues
Showcases capability level work to their team


Required Education
BA/BS in Information Technology, Computer Science, or equivalent combination of education and experience


Required Related Work Experience and Number of Years
Database management systems, - 0-1
Coding, testing and designing software, - 0-1
Software development methodologies - 0-1


WORKING CONDITIONS
Office environment


ESW340 2024-44524 2024

Here, employees don’t just have jobs, they build careers. That’s why we believe in offering a comprehensive pay and benefits package that rewards employees for their contributions to our success, supports all aspects of their well-being, and delivers real value at every stage of life.

A qualified applicant’s criminal history, if any, will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable laws, including local ordinances.

This job posting will remain open until 2024-12-09 11:00 PM (UTC) and will be extended if necessary.

The base pay for this position generally is between $67,100.00 and $107,300.00. The actual compensation offered will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. We comply with local wage minimums and also, certain positions are eligible for additional forms of other incentive-based compensation such as bonuses.

Get to Know Us Charter Communications is known in the United States by our Spectrum brands, including: Spectrum Internet®, TV, Mobile and Voice, Spectrum Networks, Spectrum Enterprise and Spectrum Reach. When you join us, you’re joining a strong community of more than 100,000 individuals working together to serve nearly 32 million customers in 41 states and keep them connected to what matters most. Watch this video to learn more.

Who You Are Matters Here We’re committed to growing a workforce that reflects our communities, and providing equal opportunities for employment and advancement. EOE, including disability/vets. Learn about our inclusive culture.

Here, employees don’t just have jobs, they build careers. That’s why we believe in offering a comprehensive compensation and benefits package that rewards employees for their contributions to our success, supports all aspects of their well-being, and delivers real value at every stage of life. We don’t just say it, we live it.

We invest in a comprehensive blend of core benefits, supplemental benefits, educational tools and resources as well as complimentary/discounted Spectrum services. Explore what a career with Spectrum looks like:

  • Starting wage of $20/hr
  • Paid, on-the-job training and significant opportunities for advancement
  • Earn an associate degree, bachelor’s degree or professional certificate tuition-free through our partnership with Guild
  • High quality and affordable health care coverage for all employees and their family members
  • Spectrum has absorbed the full cost increase for medical, dental and vision for the last 11 years, keeping employee costs flat
  • Paid time off including vacation, sick time, personal days and holidays
  • 401(k) with 100% match up to 6% of pay plus an additional 3% company contribution to a Retirement Accumulation Plan
  • Free and discounted Spectrum services and deep discounts on Spectrum MobileTM regardless of where you live

Providing our employees and their families with access to comprehensive health coverage, helping build wealth for retirement and offering educational/development opportunities are of the utmost importance to us.

'}, 'overallBenefitRating': 4.1}, 'numReviews': 3}, 'employerContent': {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContent', 'diversityContent': {'__typename': 'DiversityAndInclusionContent', 'goals': []}, 'featuredVideoLink': 'https://youtu.be/FUdvF6eZTWY?si=JIme7lgjj8bWb3zT', 'managedContent': [{'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

A wide range of ideas. A broad scope of solutions. Inspiring innovation and technology, Spectrum provides a full suite of advanced broadband services, including Spectrum TV™ video entertainment programming, Spectrum Internet™ access, and Spectrum Voice™ to over 32 million customers in 41 states. Spectrum Business® similarly provides scalable, tailored, and cost-effective broadband communications solutions to business organizations, such as business-to-business internet access, data networking, business telephone, video/music entertainment services, and wireless backhaul. The advertising sales and production services are sold under the Spectrum Reach™ brand while the news and sports networks are operated under the Spectrum Networks brand.\xa0

In this video, learn about our 100,000 employees, products and services, advertising solutions, 24/7 local news and sports programming as well as how our dependable network is empowering our customers to achieve their fullest potential.

Start your Spectrum career at jobs.spectrum.com

', 'captions': None, 'id': 44728, 'photos': None, 'title': 'About Us', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': ['']}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

Share your skills. Join our ranks. Nearly one in ten people at Spectrum have a relationship with the U.S. military. They all bring unique experiences and training to our teams. And with robust programs and partnerships, we're helping transitioning service members, veterans, guard, and reserve members - as well as military spouses - make the most of their civilian careers. An award-winning environment We foster a work culture where veterans can thrive. Forbes has recognized our commitment to our military team members by acknowledging us for creating a veteran-friendly work environment

', 'captions': None, 'id': 177481, 'photos': None, 'title': 'Military ', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': ['']}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

We know that a positive, supportive team can make all the difference for a successful career. Spectrum believes in fostering a culture in which every employee feels respected, engaged, and able to bring who they are to the communities they serve. With over \xa0101,700 employees, our hardworking and diverse workforce is focused on helping our business grow, and we are committed to helping them grow. Together we deliver industry-leading products and services to exceed customer expectations.

Spectrum fosters a collaborative environment where everyone is encouraged to work together and learn from each other—regardless of their title or team. Our employees take pride in their fast-paced, dynamic work culture and encourage each other to reach their full potential. We continuously evaluate our roles as culture creators, and strive to deliver high-quality products and services by embracing the unique perspectives and experiences of our employees and partners.

', 'captions': None, 'id': 44729, 'photos': None, 'title': 'Our Culture', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': ['']}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

Spectrum’s efforts to foster an environment of inclusion, diversity and respect touches every facet of our company. An inclusive workplace not only encourages team members to share their ideas and listen to others, it drives employee engagement, retention, productivity, and helps make us a company of choice.

In addition to our workforce, we are proud of the diverse programming we offer customers, our growing relationships with diverse suppliers, and our investment in communities to close the digital divide. We are proud that Spectrum reflects the full range of diversity and abilities in the markets we serve, and are actively working to promote diversity at every level of our organization.

', 'captions': None, 'id': 44730, 'photos': None, 'title': 'Diversity', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': ['']}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

As an intern at Spectrum, you’ll work on challenging projects that will allow you to develop your skills and learn about our industry. You’ll work closely with a Mentor in a real-life business setting to acquire practical, hands-on work experience that you’ll use in your professional career.

Opportunities in our Internship Program are available in Sales & Marketing, Finance & Accounting, Engineering, Information Technology, Network Operations, TV/Media, Customer Operations, and Field Operations. Invent your future here!

Have a question? Connect with us today at University@charter.com or visit us at jobs.spectrum.com/internships to learn more.

column13:
JOB DESCRIPTION

At Citadel, Software Engineers are responsible for building the systems that power every aspect of our investment process, from research and analysis to trading, risk management, funding and settlement. Working side by side with investors and quantitative researchers, we use our technical skills to drive critical commercial outcomes. If you’re interested in financial markets and excited by the prospect of having real impact in a fast-paced environment where everyone is inspired to be their best, we’re excited to meet you.

Our most successful engineers are critical thinkers who know how to dissect the problem as proficiently as they know how to build the solution. While we look for technical acumen, commercial acumen is just as important. That includes the ability to flex, change course, and iterate without always having pre-defined specs.

YOUR OPPORTUNITY:
From system engineers who create next-gen platforms to desk-aligned developers who partner with investment teams to increase efficiency and maximize returns, our engineering opportunities are as varied as they are challenging. If you are selected for an interview, one of our recruiters will be in touch to review the specific roles, teams and regions that best align with your skills, seniority, and experience.

YOUR SKILLS & TALENTS:
 * 6+ years of professional software engineering experience
 * Solid computer science fundamentals
 * Expert level programing skills in at least one of the following: Java, C++, Python
 * Proven track record in software design and development
 * Excellent analysis / problem solving skills
 * Strong communication and teamwork skills
 * Ability to manage multiple tasks in a demanding and dynamic environment
 * Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related STEM discipline



In accordance with New York City’s Pay Transparency Law, the base salary range for this role is $150,000 to $300,000. Base salary does not include other forms of compensation or benefits.


ABOUT CITADEL

Citadel is one of the world’s leading alternative investment managers. We manage capital on behalf of many of the world’s preeminent private, public and nonprofit institutions. We seek the highest and best use of investor capital in order to deliver market leading results and contribute to broader economic growth. For over 30 years, Citadel has cultivated a culture of learning and collaboration among some of the most talented and accomplished investment professionals, researchers and engineers in the world. Our colleagues are empowered to test their ideas and develop commercial solutions that accelerate their growth and drive real impact.

Investing in Your Growth

  • Continuous Learning – Our dedicated learning and development team matches employees with industry experts to provide personalized skill development. Our team members are encouraged to pursue advanced degrees with company reimbursement.
  • After Hours – We host exclusive events for colleagues, friends, and family. From box seats at stadiums to theater buyouts and cooking classes, you will bond with colleagues at global and local events.
  • Nourish & Energize – Healthy foods and snacks keep our teams at peak performance.
  • On-Site Fitness Centers – Reach new levels of personal performance with access to fitness centers.

Who we are

As one of the world’s leading alternative investment managers, we identify the highest and best uses of capital to generate superior long-term returns for the world’s preeminent public and private institutions. \xa0

Get to know Citadel \xa0

What we do

We drive capital to the world’s most impactful and compelling investments, leveraging our unmatched talent, technology, analytics and global scale. We pursue a variety of strategies to capture undiscovered market opportunities. \xa0

Discover our strategies \xa0 \xa0

Our culture

Our aim is to be the most successful investment team in the world. That’s why every member of our team helps develop and execute on powerful insights. Investment professionals, engineers and quantitative researchers come together to learn from each other and quickly build extraordinary careers. Together, we do what others consider impossible. \xa0

Meet our teams

', 'captions': None, 'id': 28842, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/14937/citadel-template-1728585609700.jpg', 'https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/14937/citadel-template-1696869272666.jpg'], 'title': 'Life at Citadel', 'type': 'TMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

Engineering

Our engineers build the systems and tools that power our business to operate in real time. They also create market-leading experiences for our clients and partners so markets function efficiently. As an engineer, you can create systems architectures, develop platforms and build web frameworks. You’ll have access to state-of-the-art tools and apply innovative techniques including distributed computing, natural language processing, machine learning and more.

Explore Engineering at Citadel

Quantitative Research

Our quantitative researchers work collaboratively to apply advanced statistical techniques and engineering acumen to model markets, test hypotheses and create trading algorithms in the world’s most competitive and dynamic markets. Our quants apply their mathematical and coding aptitude to help execute trades at scale.

Explore Quantitative Research at Citadel

Markets & Trading

Our traders make complex risk decisions and execute trades at scale, in real-time. As a markets and trading expert, you’ll use predictive analytics and advanced technology to monitor risk, respond to market signals and execute trading strategies across Options, ETFs, Equities, Fixed Income, Commodities and Currencies.

Explore Markets & Trading at Citadel

Explore our internships

An internship at Citadel is more than a job—it’s an experience. Apply your curiosity and engage in meaningful work with the brightest minds in the industry.

Over the course of 11 weeks, our interns:

  • Benefit from mentorship: Receive constructive, tailored guidance to help you learn and deliver your best.
  • Develop valuable skills: Participate in classes, seminars and coffee chats led by our industry experts.
  • Make an impact: Apply what you learn working side-by-side with our full-time early-career employees.
  • Explore the community: Experience the city with exclusive access to things like top cultural spots and sporting events.

Find out more about our Internships

View open positions

If you’re interested in financial markets and excited by the prospect of having real impact in a fast-paced environment where everyone is inspired to be their best, we’re excited to meet you.
Our most successful engineers are critical thinkers who know how to dissect the problem as proficiently as they know how to build the solution. While we look for technical acumen, commercial acumen is just as important. That includes the ability to flex, change course, and iterate without always having pre-defined specs.
YOUR OPPORTUNITY:
From system engineers who create next-gen platforms to desk-aligned developers who partner with investment teams to increase efficiency and maximize returns, our engineering opportunities are as varied as they are challenging. If you are selected for an interview, one of our recruiters will be in touch to review the specific roles, teams and regions that best align with your skills, seniority, and experience.
YOUR SKILLS & TALENTS:
  • 6+ years of professional software engineering experience
  • Solid computer science fundamentals
  • Expert level programing skills in at least one of the following: Java, C++, Python
  • Proven track record in software design and development
  • Excellent analysis / problem solving skills
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks in a demanding and dynamic environment
  • Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related STEM discipline

In accordance with New York City’s Pay Transparency Law, the base salary range for this role is $150,000 to $300,000. Base salary does not include other forms of compensation or benefits.

About Citadel

Citadel is one of the world’s leading alternative investment managers. We manage capital on behalf of many of the world’s preeminent private, public and nonprofit institutions. We seek the highest and best use of investor capital in order to deliver market leading results and contribute to broader economic growth. For over 30 years, Citadel has cultivated a culture of learning and collaboration among some of the most talented and accomplished investment professionals, researchers and engineers in the world. Our colleagues are empowered to test their ideas and develop commercial solutions that accelerate their growth and drive real impact.

column13:
JOB DESCRIPTION

At Citadel, our engineers work in small teams to turn the best ideas into high-performing and resilient technology. With short development cycles, work rapidly goes into production. As an engineer, you can create systems architectures, develop platforms and build web frameworks. You’ll have access to state-of-the-art tools and apply innovative techniques including distributed computing, natural language processing, machine learning and more.

Your Objectives:
 * Create technological tools that bring trading strategies to life
 * Develop high-performance, large data research platforms
 * Work in small teams to build the future of finance


Your Skills & Talents:
 * Bachelor’s, master’s or PhD in computer science, computer engineering or related fields
 * Exceptional programming and design skills
 * Strong analytical skills and familiarity with probability and statistics
 * Ability to communicate effectively in a collaborative, complex and highly technical team environment
 * Intellectual curiosity and passion for solving challenging problems using technology


Opportunities available in Chicago, Miami, New York.



In accordance with New York City’s Pay Transparency Law, the base salary range for this role is $200,000 to $250,000. Base salary does not include other forms of compensation or benefits.


ABOUT CITADEL

Citadel is one of the world’s leading alternative investment managers. We manage capital on behalf of many of the world’s preeminent private, public and nonprofit institutions. We seek the highest and best use of investor capital in order to deliver market leading results and contribute to broader economic growth. For over 30 years, Citadel has cultivated a culture of learning and collaboration among some of the most talented and accomplished investment professionals, researchers and engineers in the world. Our colleagues are empowered to test their ideas and develop commercial solutions that accelerate their growth and drive real impact.

Investing in Your Growth

  • Continuous Learning – Our dedicated learning and development team matches employees with industry experts to provide personalized skill development. Our team members are encouraged to pursue advanced degrees with company reimbursement.
  • After Hours – We host exclusive events for colleagues, friends, and family. From box seats at stadiums to theater buyouts and cooking classes, you will bond with colleagues at global and local events.
  • Nourish & Energize – Healthy foods and snacks keep our teams at peak performance.
  • On-Site Fitness Centers – Reach new levels of personal performance with access to fitness centers.
'}, 'overallBenefitRating': 4.5}, 'numReviews': 3}, 'employerContent': {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContent', 'diversityContent': {'__typename': 'DiversityAndInclusionContent', 'goals': []}, 'featuredVideoLink': '', 'managedContent': [{'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

Who we are

As one of the world’s leading alternative investment managers, we identify the highest and best uses of capital to generate superior long-term returns for the world’s preeminent public and private institutions. \xa0

Get to know Citadel \xa0

What we do

We drive capital to the world’s most impactful and compelling investments, leveraging our unmatched talent, technology, analytics and global scale. We pursue a variety of strategies to capture undiscovered market opportunities. \xa0

Discover our strategies \xa0 \xa0

Our culture

Our aim is to be the most successful investment team in the world. That’s why every member of our team helps develop and execute on powerful insights. Investment professionals, engineers and quantitative researchers come together to learn from each other and quickly build extraordinary careers. Together, we do what others consider impossible. \xa0

Meet our teams

', 'captions': None, 'id': 28842, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/14937/citadel-template-1728585609700.jpg', 'https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/14937/citadel-template-1696869272666.jpg'], 'title': 'Life at Citadel', 'type': 'TMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

Engineering

Our engineers build the systems and tools that power our business to operate in real time. They also create market-leading experiences for our clients and partners so markets function efficiently. As an engineer, you can create systems architectures, develop platforms and build web frameworks. You’ll have access to state-of-the-art tools and apply innovative techniques including distributed computing, natural language processing, machine learning and more.

Explore Engineering at Citadel

Quantitative Research

Our quantitative researchers work collaboratively to apply advanced statistical techniques and engineering acumen to model markets, test hypotheses and create trading algorithms in the world’s most competitive and dynamic markets. Our quants apply their mathematical and coding aptitude to help execute trades at scale.

Explore Quantitative Research at Citadel

Markets & Trading

Our traders make complex risk decisions and execute trades at scale, in real-time. As a markets and trading expert, you’ll use predictive analytics and advanced technology to monitor risk, respond to market signals and execute trading strategies across Options, ETFs, Equities, Fixed Income, Commodities and Currencies.

Explore Markets & Trading at Citadel

', 'captions': None, 'id': 216798, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/14937/citadel-template-1728585611096.jpg', 'https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/14937/citadel-template-1723739470093.jpg'], 'title': 'Career Paths', 'type': 'TMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

Explore our internships

An internship at Citadel is more than a job—it’s an experience. Apply your curiosity and engage in meaningful work with the brightest minds in the industry.

Over the course of 11 weeks, our interns:

  • Benefit from mentorship: Receive constructive, tailored guidance to help you learn and deliver your best.
  • Develop valuable skills: Participate in classes, seminars and coffee chats led by our industry experts.
  • Make an impact: Apply what you learn working side-by-side with our full-time early-career employees.
  • Explore the community: Experience the city with exclusive access to things like top cultural spots and sporting events.

Find out more about our Internships

View open positions

'urgencySignal': None}, 'job': {'__typename': 'JobDetails', 'description': '

Job Description

At Citadel, our engineers work in small teams to turn the best ideas into high-performing and resilient technology. With short development cycles, work rapidly goes into production. As an engineer, you can create systems architectures, develop platforms and build web frameworks. You’ll have access to state-of-the-art tools and apply innovative techniques including distributed computing, natural language processing, machine learning and more.
Your Objectives:
  • Create technological tools that bring trading strategies to life
  • Develop high-performance, large data research platforms
  • Work in small teams to build the future of finance
Your Skills & Talents:
  • Bachelor’s, master’s or PhD in computer science, computer engineering or related fields
  • Exceptional programming and design skills
  • Strong analytical skills and familiarity with probability and statistics
  • Ability to communicate effectively in a collaborative, complex and highly technical team environment
  • Intellectual curiosity and passion for solving challenging problems using technology
Opportunities available in Chicago, Miami, New York.

In accordance with New York City’s Pay Transparency Law, the base salary range for this role is $200,000 to $250,000. Base salary does not include other forms of compensation or benefits.

About Citadel

Citadel is one of the world’s leading alternative investment managers. We manage capital on behalf of many of the world’s preeminent private, public and nonprofit institutions. We seek the highest and best use of investor capital in order to deliver market leading results and contribute to broader economic growth. For over 30 years, Citadel has cultivated a culture of learning and collaboration among some of the most talented and accomplished investment professionals, researchers and engineers in the world. Our colleagues are empowered to test their ideas and develop commercial solutions that accelerate their growth and drive real impact.

column13:
Description: Manage Athena biometric identification programs to include serving as Program Manager of the Iraq automated biometric identification system (IABIS) program. Duties include delivering systems and services required by the IABIS contract, managing subcontractors, interfacing with US Army managers, procuring needed items, maintaining budgets and schedules, managing project risks, coordinating delivery and shipping of items overseas, preparing periodic work reports, and meeting contract delivery items. Additional duties include pursuing new customers in the biometric identification market. Successful candidate must be able to travel into the CENTCOM to meet with stakeholders and deployed staff.

BS degree in engineering or computer science

10+ years experience developing and delivering software systems to federal customers

Understanding of biometric matching technology and operations

5+ years managing department of defense projects

Ability to travel into the CENTCOM to meet with stakeholders and staff.

Design and development of multi-modal ABIS solutions and biometric collection technology

PMI certified PMP

Certified scrum master

CENTCOM biometrics intelligence operations

Understanding of federal acquisition regulations and procurement practices

Ability to author proposals and complex technical reports.

Understanding of EBTS

Ability to author project management and engineering plans

Salary $130k to $170k depending in skills and experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $170,000.00 per year

Benefits:

 * 401(k)
 * 401(k) matching
 * Dental insurance
 * Health insurance
 * Vision insurance

Application Question(s):

 * Are you a US citizen?

Work Location: In person

'urgencySignal': None}, 'job': {'__typename': 'JobDetails', 'description': '

Description: Manage Athena biometric identification programs to include serving as Program Manager of the Iraq automated biometric identification system (IABIS) program. Duties include delivering systems and services required by the IABIS contract, managing subcontractors, interfacing with US Army managers, procuring needed items, maintaining budgets and schedules, managing project risks, coordinating delivery and shipping of items overseas, preparing periodic work reports, and meeting contract delivery items. Additional duties include pursuing new customers in the biometric identification market. Successful candidate must be able to travel into the CENTCOM to meet with stakeholders and deployed staff.

BS degree in engineering or computer science

10+ years experience developing and delivering software systems to federal customers

Understanding of biometric matching technology and operations

5+ years managing department of defense projects

Ability to travel into the CENTCOM to meet with stakeholders and staff.

Design and development of multi-modal ABIS solutions and biometric collection technology

PMI certified PMP

Certified scrum master

CENTCOM biometrics intelligence operations

Understanding of federal acquisition regulations and procurement practices

Ability to author proposals and complex technical reports.

Understanding of EBTS

Ability to author project management and engineering plans

Salary $130k to $170k depending in skills and experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $170,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • 401(k) matching
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Vision insurance

Application Question(s):

  • Are you a US citizen?

Work Location: In person

column13:
Jr. Software Engineer - Remote
Contract End Date: October 2026

We are actively recruiting for a Developer for a contract to modernize a large suite of applications. The successful candidate possesses and applies a comprehensive knowledge across key tasks and high impact assignments; Plans and completes major technology assignments; Functions as a technical expert across multiple project assignments; Designs, plans and builds software or customize software for use with the aim of satisfying various aspects of requirements for a software release. Also responsible for contributing to automated tests including unit, integration, and UI.

Please note this is a full-time 100% remote work opportunity with Changeis.

Roles and Responsibilities:
 * Reviewing the System Architecture documentation including a CI/CD framework
 * Contribute to a range of development activities for a suite of applications.
 * Work both independently and within a team structure.
 * Adhere to and contribute to internal processes.
 * Contribute to technical documentation by writing technical descriptions of system design as well as produce relevant diagrams when useful.
 * Other duties as assigned.

SKILL MATRIX
 * At least 3-5 years of relevant experience for a US Federal organization preferred
 * Software Development experience with a high-level language such as .NET, Java, Python, JS/TS
 * Experience working with PL/SQL a plus
 * Designing or customizing complex applications integrated with a CI/CD platform.

column13:
We are data driven software company in the Powersports business, we are growing and hiring additional staff. If you are interested in working for a fast growing company in the exciting world of motorcycles and Powersports keep reading. We offer a great balance between your personal life and work responsibilities.

If you have ever wanted a position that is responsible for creating applications that make a difference in an industry and completely change how an entire industry does business this is your chance.

We are seeking to hire a Senior Level Programmer with skills in full LAMP stack development, MySql, and PHP. The candidate needs to have a high-level of competence with web development best practices, front end web development, PHP/MySQL, and javascript.

There is a need to be well-versed in responsive design using frameworks such as Bootstrap or Foundation CSS.

This candidate that fills this position will be responsible for writing clean and efficient code.

The position is full time and answers directly to the president and CEO of the company.

Requirements:
* Full-stack web development
* PHP and MySQL
* Must be skilled in writing clean, efficient code
* HTML5 and CSS3
* jQuery or Javascript and VueJS

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

 * Health insurance
 * Paid holidays
 * Paid time off

Compensation Package:

 * Bonus opportunities

Schedule:

 * Monday to Friday

Experience:

 * MySQL: 5 years (Required)
 * Web development: 5 years (Required)
 * PHP: 5 years (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

 * Charlotte, NC: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

column13:
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Kafka Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will lead the design, development, and maintenance of our Kafka-based messaging systems. Your expertise will play a pivotal role in building robust, scalable, and secure data streaming pipelines to support our real-time data needs.

This is an exciting opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and collaborate with a team of passionate professionals dedicated to building world-class enterprise solutions. If you’re passionate about solving complex challenges we’d love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities:

 * Design, implement, and manage Kafka-based messaging and streaming systems, including Kafka brokers, Zookeeper, Kafka Connect, and Kafka Streams.
 * Develop scalable and high-performance solutions for streaming data pipelines.
 * Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize Kafka clusters to ensure reliability, scalability, and security.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data architecture and integrate Kafka solutions into enterprise systems.
 * Create automation scripts and tools for managing Kafka infrastructure.
 * Implement and enforce best practices for data governance, including schema management and versioning using tools like Confluent Schema Registry.
 * Support real-time data processing and analytics by building Kafka-based integrations.
 * Mentor junior engineers and share best practices with the team.
 * Stay up-to-date with the latest Kafka and distributed systems technologies, providing recommendations for improvements.

Requirements:

Technical Skills:

 * Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
 * 5+ years of professional experience with Apache Kafka in a production environment.
 * Deep understanding of Kafka architecture, including brokers, partitions, topics, consumer groups, and offset management.
 * Experience with Kafka Connect, Kafka Streams, and Confluent Platform.
 * Strong programming skills in Java, Scala, or Python, with a focus on building Kafka producers and consumers.
 * Experience with containerization tools like Docker and orchestration tools such as Kubernetes.
 * Familiarity with messaging patterns, distributed systems, and event-driven architecture.
 * Hands-on experience with monitoring tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, or Confluent Control Center.
 * Proficiency in deploying and managing Kafka clusters in cloud environments like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
 * Strong knowledge of database systems (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.) and how they integrate with Kafka.

Soft Skills:

 * Exceptional problem-solving skills and a proactive mindset.
 * Excellent communication and collaboration abilities with technical and non-technical teams.
 * Proven ability to mentor junior team members and contribute to a positive team environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

 * Experience with Kafka Security (TLS/SSL, SASL, Kerberos).
 * Knowledge of real-time analytics tools like Apache Flink or Spark Streaming.
 * Familiarity with DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines.
 * Experience with managing large-scale Kafka clusters with high throughput and low latency requirements.
 * Certifications in Kafka or cloud technologies (e.g., Confluent Certified Developer, AWS Certified Solutions Architect).

What We Offer:
- Competitive salary plus performance-based bonuses.
- Comprehensive benefits package including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off.
- Opportunities for career growth in a rapidly evolving AI/ML landscape.
- Access to cutting-edge tools and resources to push the boundaries of AI research and application.
- Collaborative work environment that values innovation, creativity, and continuous learning.

About Us:
We are a forward-thinking company focused on leveraging artificial intelligence to solve real-world problems. Our mission is to build transformative solutions that empower businesses and enhance lives through the power of AI. Join us to be part of an exciting journey shaping the future of technology.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $138,047.00 - $149,927.00 per year

Compensation Package:

 * Bonus opportunities
 * Performance bonus

Schedule:

 * Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

column13:
AV3, Inc. is a small, Native American and Veteran owned Audiovisual (AV) Systems Integration company headquartered in Southern Maryland. Supported by Belmont Point Management LLC's Executive Leadership team, we've earned a reputation as a premiere AV integration and installation provider serving the Intelligence and Defense communities, Maryland Public School System, and diversified, worldwide commercial customers.

We are excited to be recruiting for new talent to join our growing and innovative team – Senior AV Programmer. This position codes, tests, debugs, documents, and installs new AV software and updates existing ones. This fast-paced position works directly with the Programming team, Project Managers, Engineers and customers to identify opportunities to improve operating effectiveness and efficiency of software applications.

The responsibilities of this role may include:

 * Completes assigned software implementation tasks with high quality and on schedule
 * Writes structured application/interface code from specifications conforming to established methodology and standards for AV systems such as AMX, Crestron and Extron control systems
 * Conducts unit tests of either new or modified AV applications
 * Updates firmware on AV equipment
 * Reads AV drawings
 * Participates in code reviews to represent reviewed work for adherence to standards and specifications
 * Writes or revises program documentation, operations documentation and user guides
 * Proactively monitors the performance of assigned application software and makes approved changes to improve operating efficiency and effectiveness of assigned applications
 * Proactively diagnoses and corrects applications and software problems and improve operating performance
 * Documents new programs or changes to existing programs
 * Performs preventive and routine maintenance
 * Designs touch panel interfaces
 * Assists engineers with system design
 * Configures digital signal processors, A/V switchers, and other devices
 * Customizes systems to our end-user's requirements
 * Identifies software/hardware issues and troubleshoots them
 * Provides support for existing systems
 * Performs all other duties as assigned

To qualify for this position, you must possess a Bachelors of Science in Computer Science or relevant discipline and at least 7 years of AV programming experience.

Additional qualifications include:

 * AMX Certified Programmer preferred
 * Extron Authorized Programmer preferred
 * Extron Control Specialist preferred
 * Crestron Masters Certified Programmer preferred
 * Ability to travel to various CONUS and OCONUS locations as required, up to 25% of the time

What sets AV3, Inc. apart?

Founded in 2006, AV3 quickly established a reputation of exceeding customer expectations and remains a leading, cutting edge AV and multimedia systems organization. We set our standards high! From rapid response to customer requests, to in-house systems configuration and onsite installation, through maintenance; the dedication and expertise of our experienced workforce sets us apart.

Benefits

Our approach is simple – we invest in our employees who in turn provide turnkey products and support to our customers. If you are eager to advance in an employee first organization that is eager to grow alongside you, AV3 Inc. is your employer of choice.

For all regular, full time employees, we offer:

 * Employer shared Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
 * Employer paid Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, and Basic Life Insurance
 * Voluntary Life Insurance
 * 401(k) Plan with Matching Contributions
 * Paid Time Off
 * Eleven (11) Paid Holidays
 * Work-Life Balance
 * Awesome and Rewarding Culture!

Pay Range

$100,000 - $135,000 per year

The above pay range represents a general guideline; however, AV3, Inc. considers a number of factors when determining base pay offers such as the scope and responsibilities of the position and the candidate's experience, education, skills and current market conditions. Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay.

AV3, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer for all including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans. We participate in E-Verify.

column13:
This is a remote position.

We’re looking for a passionate Software Engineer to design, develop and install software solutions. Ideally, the candidate should be able to build high-quality, innovative and fully performing software in compliance with coding standards and technical design. Software engineers must be skilled in development, writing code, and documenting functionality.



 * Executing full life-cycle software development
 * Writing well-designed, testable, efficient code
 * Producing specifications and determining operational feasibility
 * Integrating software components into fully functional software systems
 * Developing software verification plans and quality assurance procedures
 * Documenting and maintaining software functionality
 * Tailoring and deploying software tools, processes and metrics
 * Serving as a subject matter expert
 * Complying with project plans and industry standards
   
   




BENEFITS

 * Good rate of pay. Developers have a higher starting wage bracket all worldwide.
 * The skills are transferable. The skills you acquire will never be out of use.
 * Work anywhere . As a developer you aren’t limited to a particular region or country as 1’s and 0’s are understood everywhere.
 * Comfortable Working Environment. Wherever you go, you’ll have an air-conditioned office, fast internet and a powerful laptop. What more does a man need?
 * Constant learning curve. You will only get better with passing time as you will be in sync with the technological changes.
 * You can be as creative as you want. Each day you create something from nothing. The only thing that limits you will be your imagination.
   
   
   
   
 * Maternity/paternity leave. Pursue career goals while growing your family.
 * Professional development. Get opportunities for professional development, to master new skills and to grow into other roles.


High School or Equivalent

column13:
DESCRIPTION


We are on a journey to help the next million creators, publishers, and companies scale and monetize their audiences. beehiiv is already home to tens of thousands of the most popular newsletters in the world, and we're only 3 years old! The company quickly achieved $1M ARR in January 2023 and over $7M just a year later in January 2024 .

Oh, and the team is loaded with the some of the most talented and ambitious engineers in the industry.

We want beehiiv users to have the most beautiful, dynamic, and design-forward emails in the world. You'll be responsible for making that a reality. beehiiv currently sends over 2B emails per month !!


You will be a great fit if you have a well thought-out technical perspective that you balance with a practical desire to ship to customers. We’re seeking a self-motivated teammate who communicates early and often, and strives for the whole team to succeed.

We respect each other as individuals and know work is just one part of life; we want you to have the flexibility and support you need to achieve fulfillment in your personal and professional lives.

Technologies we work with:
 * HTML/CSS
 * Ruby on Rails
 * React
 * Typescript
 * ProseMirror
 * Redis, PostgreSQL, and SQL

Ideally you will have:
 * Experience building (and debugging) beautiful, lightweight, and performant HTML emails
 * Experience building front-end solutions using React and Typescript
 * Comfortable writing thorough tests and prioritizing QA and related processes
 * Strong troubleshooting skills
 * Experience working with an agile development team
 * Strong troubleshooting skills
 * 4+ years of relevant work experience

Nice to have:
 * Experience with Ruby on Rails
 * Experience using Heroku, Sentry, Github
 * Familiarity with email-specific topics, such as HTML email templating, cross-device management, SMTP, email deliverability, integrating with ESPs, inbox providers, etc.
 * Keen design eye and a passion for building great user experiences
 * Experience working on small, highly productive engineering teams
 * Experience optimizing high throughput postgres databases
 * Experience with Redis, Sidekiq, and Remix.js



WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR


 * We want beehiiv users to have the most beautiful, dynamic, and design-forward emails in the world. You'll be responsible for making that a reality.
 * That includes all of the in-platform tools, templates, and customizations available to bring them to life.
 * Becoming proficient with our technology stack (Ruby, Rails, Typescript, React, ProseMirror)
 * Routinely shipping meaningful features that increase our users' ability to grow, monetize and make great newsletters
 * Leading the development of several high-impact product initiatives
 * Prioritizing and triaging a backlog of in-demand feature requests and bugs
 * Transitioning our tech ecosystem into a more robust and performant version of itself, continuously optimizing for scale
 * Documenting your thought processes and development
 * Bringing new ideas to work, suggesting creative solutions, and collaborating with others to bring the absolute best product to market



WHY BEEHIIV?


We're remote. We believe that your best work is done where you feel safe, comfortable, and supported.

Empathy, not ego. Empathy opens the door to problem solving. Our team is uniquely talented and we can solve any problem when we lead with empathy.

Bias towards action. Most decisions can be changed or altered, but progress cannot be created without action. It is almost always better to deliver something today over something that may be better tomorrow.


Complete transparency. You will have full access to business metrics about the company.

Owner-attitude. Ownership creates a sense of pride and accountability. It empowers someone to stand up for what is right, with a long-term outlook.



WE'LL TAKE CARE OF YOU


 * Competitive salary
 * Stock Options
 * Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
 * 401(k) employer match
 * Unlimited PTO (mandatory 10 days per year minimum)
 * Twice-annual in-person team retreat
 * Unlimited book budget
 * Two month sabbatical every three years
 * Mental health day each month



ABOUT BEEHIIV

We're empowering creators to create, monetize, and grow by building the most powerful and robust newsletter platform, built by newsletter people. And we're only just getting started

beehiiv is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. beehiiv is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Description


We are on a journey to help the next million creators, publishers, and companies scale and monetize their audiences. beehiiv is already home to tens of thousands of the most popular newsletters in the world, and we're only 3 years old! The company quickly achieved $1M ARR in January 2023 and over $7M just a year later in January 2024 .

Oh, and the team is loaded with the some of the most talented and ambitious engineers in the industry.

We want beehiiv users to have the most beautiful, dynamic, and design-forward emails in the world. You'll be responsible for making that a reality. beehiiv currently sends over 2B emails per month !!

You will be a great fit if you have a well thought-out technical perspective that you balance with a practical desire to ship to customers. We’re seeking a self-motivated teammate who communicates early and often, and strives for the whole team to succeed.
We respect each other as individuals and know work is just one part of life; we want you to have the flexibility and support you need to achieve fulfillment in your personal and professional lives.

Technologies we work with:
  • HTML/CSS
  • Ruby on Rails
  • React
  • Typescript
  • ProseMirror
  • Redis, PostgreSQL, and SQL
Ideally you will have:
  • Experience building (and debugging) beautiful, lightweight, and performant HTML emails
  • Experience building front-end solutions using React and Typescript
  • Comfortable writing thorough tests and prioritizing QA and related processes
  • Strong troubleshooting skills
  • Experience working with an agile development team
  • Strong troubleshooting skills
  • 4+ years of relevant work experience
Nice to have:
  • Experience with Ruby on Rails
  • Experience using Heroku, Sentry, Github
  • Familiarity with email-specific topics, such as HTML email templating, cross-device management, SMTP, email deliverability, integrating with ESPs, inbox providers, etc.
  • Keen design eye and a passion for building great user experiences
  • Experience working on small, highly productive engineering teams
  • Experience optimizing high throughput postgres databases
  • Experience with Redis, Sidekiq, and Remix.js

What you will be responsible for


  • We want beehiiv users to have the most beautiful, dynamic, and design-forward emails in the world. You'll be responsible for making that a reality.
  • That includes all of the in-platform tools, templates, and customizations available to bring them to life.
  • Becoming proficient with our technology stack (Ruby, Rails, Typescript, React, ProseMirror)
  • Routinely shipping meaningful features that increase our users' ability to grow, monetize and make great newsletters
  • Leading the development of several high-impact product initiatives
  • Prioritizing and triaging a backlog of in-demand feature requests and bugs
  • Transitioning our tech ecosystem into a more robust and performant version of itself, continuously optimizing for scale
  • Documenting your thought processes and development
  • Bringing new ideas to work, suggesting creative solutions, and collaborating with others to bring the absolute best product to market

Why beehiiv?


We're remote. We believe that your best work is done where you feel safe, comfortable, and supported.

Empathy, not ego. Empathy opens the door to problem solving. Our team is uniquely talented and we can solve any problem when we lead with empathy.

Bias towards action. Most decisions can be changed or altered, but progress cannot be created without action. It is almost always better to deliver something today over something that may be better tomorrow.

Complete transparency. You will have full access to business metrics about the company.
Owner-attitude. Ownership creates a sense of pride and accountability. It empowers someone to stand up for what is right, with a long-term outlook.


We'll take care of you


  • Competitive salary
  • Stock Options
  • Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • 401(k) employer match
  • Unlimited PTO (mandatory 10 days per year minimum)
  • Twice-annual in-person team retreat
  • Unlimited book budget
  • Two month sabbatical every three years
  • Mental health day each month

About beehiiv

We're empowering creators to create, monetize, and grow by building the most powerful and robust newsletter platform, built by newsletter people. And we're only just getting started

beehiiv is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. beehiiv is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

column13:
Software Development Manager

2200 S. Lakeside Drive, Waukegan, IL 60085



Are you an Oracle expert, skilled in software solutions and enterprise resource planning for business? Then you belong at Uline as a Software Development Manager! Our company continues to grow, creating new career opportunities and job stability you can count on.



Better together! This position is on-site in Pleasant Prairie, WI or Waukegan, IL based on need, and we are looking for people who share our passion.



Position Responsibilities

 * Manage Uline’s Oracle EBS application, providing responsive customer service to EBS users.

 * Lead planning and implementation of large software development efforts involving multiple business stakeholders.

 * Oversee the development team, setting strategy for designing and developing complex applications based on business requirements.

 * Maintain knowledge of best practices in IT and software development / architecture.



Minimum Requirements

 * Bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science or related field.

 * 8+ years of experience managing an Oracle EBS environment and technology stack.

 * Thorough knowledge of business processes including Financials, Purchasing, Cost and Inventory.

 * Strong customer service experience in a leadership role.

 * Experience leading a highly performant team supporting critical business applications.



Benefits

 * Complete medical, dental, vision and life insurance coverage and other wellness programs.

 * 401(k) with 6% employer match. Multiple bonus programs, including profit sharing.

 * Paid holidays and generous paid time off.

 * Tuition Assistance Program that covers professional continuing education.



Employee Perks

 * Café featuring affordable daily meal options from local restaurants.

 * On-site fitness center and beautifully maintained walking paths.

 * Best-in-class, clean, modern facilities.



About Uline



Uline, a family-owned company, is North America’s leading distributor of shipping, industrial, and packaging materials with over 9,000 employees across 13 locations.



Uline is a drug-free workplace.



EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled



#LI-SR1

#CORP

(#IN-PPIT)



Our employees make the difference and we are committed to offering exceptional benefits and perks! Explore https://www.uline.jobs/#working-here_blankUline.jobs to learn more!

Everyone starts at 3 weeks PTO. '}], 'employerBenefitSummary': {'__typename': 'EmployerInfoVO', 'comment': '

We offer fantastic benefits, from great wages to complete healthcare coverage.

Immediate medical, dental, vision and life insurance coverage and 401(k) with 6% employer match starting on your first day!

Financial

  • Industry leading wages
  • Annual performance bonus
  • Sales goal bonus
  • Annual profit sharing
  • Retirement savings plan with employer contributions
  • College scholarship opportunities for children of employees

Health

  • Complete, highly competitive healthcare coverage
  • Flexible Spending Accounts
  • Medical premium stipend
  • Health education programs
  • Employee Assistance Program


Paid Time Off

  • Paid time off for vacation, sick and personal days
  • Additional days earned with tenure
  • Paid time off for major holidays


Wellness

We offer a variety of perks that encourage overall wellness and create a comfortable work environment for our employees.

Corporate

  • First class fitness center
  • Beautiful walking trails
  • Full service café
  • On-site salon/spa
  • Outdoor patio

Branches

  • Fitness center
  • Walking trails at select locations
  • On-site café
  • Chair massages
  • Outdoor patio

Social Events

Even though we work hard at Uline, we also remember to have fun.

  • Department-sponsored outings
  • Family Fun Fair
  • Annual Corrugated Boat Race
  • Corporate Summer BBQ
  • Community involvement
  • Holiday parties

Training

At Uline, we invest in our people and encourage employees to grow their skills and prepare for future roles.

  • Comprehensive orientation program
  • Departmental mentoring programs
  • In-house speakers, workshops and seminars
  • Tuition reimbursement for job-related courses
  • Tuition reduction for employees at designated colleges and universities

{'__typename': 'JobDetails', 'description': "

Software Development Manager

2200 S. Lakeside Drive, Waukegan, IL 60085

Are you an Oracle expert, skilled in software solutions and enterprise resource planning for business? Then you belong at Uline as a Software Development Manager! Our company continues to grow, creating new career opportunities and job stability you can count on.

Better together! This position is on-site in Pleasant Prairie, WI or Waukegan, IL based on need, and we are looking for people who share our passion.

Position Responsibilities

  • Manage Uline’s Oracle EBS application, providing responsive customer service to EBS users.

  • Lead planning and implementation of large software development efforts involving multiple business stakeholders.

  • Oversee the development team, setting strategy for designing and developing complex applications based on business requirements.

  • Maintain knowledge of best practices in IT and software development / architecture.

Minimum Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science or related field.

  • 8+ years of experience managing an Oracle EBS environment and technology stack.

  • Thorough knowledge of business processes including Financials, Purchasing, Cost and Inventory.

  • Strong customer service experience in a leadership role.

  • Experience leading a highly performant team supporting critical business applications.

Benefits

  • Complete medical, dental, vision and life insurance coverage and other wellness programs.

  • 401(k) with 6% employer match. Multiple bonus programs, including profit sharing.

  • Paid holidays and generous paid time off.

  • Tuition Assistance Program that covers professional continuing education.

Employee Perks

  • Café featuring affordable daily meal options from local restaurants.

  • On-site fitness center and beautifully maintained walking paths.

  • Best-in-class, clean, modern facilities.

About Uline

Uline, a family-owned company, is North America’s leading distributor of shipping, industrial, and packaging materials with over 9,000 employees across 13 locations.

Uline is a drug-free workplace.

EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled

#LI-SR1

#CORP

(#IN-PPIT)

Our employees make the difference and we are committed to offering exceptional benefits and perks! Explore https://www.uline.jobs/#working-here_blankUline.jobs to learn more!

And please look into your managers in IT, especially those who play favorites.', 'cons': "No matter how bad it is to find tech jobs, please avoid this company, the company culture is very archaic and illogical. Expressing disagreement can land you in trouble. Not liking having to work their 45 hours minimum a week or working all 5 days in the office has gotten individuals in trouble. Managers and HR play favorites, and some of their work processes are clearly a sham that screw over an employee. This is 5 days a week, in the office with a tie. While you're here: - You have to be CLOCKED in for 45 hours or you will be punished. - In order to get a promotion from software developer to senior, they require you to have an annual average of 47 hours a week at the office, regardless of how well your performance is - The company does not allow more than 4 personal items of a certain size at your cube - You will be written up for not wearing proper clothing. Typically, women are reported more often. - They often claim to have processes, but usually a decision has been made prior. There is a lack of flexibility here, even down to the most smallest details. They expect employees to be drones and think the same, it's almost cultist. Please avoid as much as possible, even during these difficult times.", 'countHelpful': 32, 'employerResponses': [{'__typename': 'EmployerResponse', 'response': 'As Uline continues to grow across North America, we are investing in emerging business solutions and growing our team to better serve our customers. Uline prides itself on being an equal opportunity employer of over 9,000 people. We’re disappointed to hear you don’t feel you’re experiencing a fair work environment or a healthy work/life balance. Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback.', 'responseDateTime': '2024-03-05T06:56:51.17', 'userJobTitle': 'Recruitment Advertising Specialist'}], 'employmentStatus': 'REGULAR', 'featured': None, 'isCurrentJob': True, 'jobTitle': {'__typename': 'JobTitle', 'text': 'Software Developer'}, 'lengthOfEmployment': 4, 'pros': "- Profit Sharing bonus (albeit not much for compared to other engineers/developers' bonuses", 'ratingBusinessOutlook': 'NEGATIVE', 'ratingCareerOpportunities': 1, 'ratingCeo': 'DISAPPROVE', 'ratingCompensationAndBenefits': 3, 'ratingCultureAndValues': 1, 'ratingOverall': 1, 'ratingRecommendToFriend': 'NEGATIVE', 'ratingSeniorLeadership': 1, 'ratingWorkLifeBalance': 2, 'reviewDateTime': '2024-02-14T14:24:38.430', 'reviewId': 84382341, 'summary': 'Do NOT work here'}, {'__typename': 'EmployerReview', 'advice': "My Top 3 For Liz - Any legal proceedings / messages to leadership of other hiring companies are perceived as HIGHLY hostile and have been noticed by each and every employee. It is not a good look and will do nothing but drive away the few non-contracted employees that are still hanging around. - You have lost touch with the people you are leading. The general consensus is there will never be any changes and the interests of the individual are never held higher than the 'quirky company culture' - I know this review will come across your desk. It will be a very advantageous decision to read through all points discussed and decide what you are willing to lose employees over.", 'cons': 'There is no easy place to begin. First and foremost, when employees were attempting to leave Liz began applying legal pressure to companies hiring people to attempt to scare away any offers being extended. This happened between the legal team getting involved, letters being sent and phone calls being made to the leadership of new companies. This has happened more than once. MANY of the Glassdoor reviews are 'fake' reviews left by HR employees to make Uline seem like a healthy place to work. Please keep this in mind when browsing reviews that are listed on this website. When people are announcing they are leaving their managers will gaslight them and say things like "Work from home is career suicide", "You are just going to make less money and be miserable". This does not speak for all leadership however, some people are great and make wise decisions. Pay has been lagging behind average market value for quite some time. Making a job change with no job title change will often come with a 20k raise. Work from home is always a firm NO. It does not matter how sick you are or if your family is needing assistance or the roads are so dangerous with snow that there are dozens of car crashes on the way to work. Under no circumstances are you able to do the exact same job from home to prevent possible harm to yourself or others. Leadership will say they do not watch the time clock (yes, a salaried position where you punch in/out at a time clock every day). However this is a lie, there is a required 45 hour minimum to prevent your manager from breathing down your neck and a 47 hour minimum if you even are considering scoring higher than a 3 on your performance review and get a well deserving promotion. There is no paid leave for maternity

column1: paternity. If you need to take bereavement you are limited to 3 days and it must be someone in your immediate family
column2: meaning if your cousin passes you will have to take time off to grieve.\n\nMany teams are under heavy scrutiny enduring hour by hour micromanagement. In cubicles you are restricted to five personal items
column3: but if these personal items do not follow the \'company image\' you will be required to take it home (eg. small figurine
column4: a picture frame with a cross on it)\n\nWhen senior leadership holds town halls and addresses questions that have been asked hard questions they will laugh it off ""haha there\'s that work from home question again... moving on"". There is more than enough evidence that employees are struggling to maintain enthusiasm for the culture they must maintain where it is truly baffling that there is questions as to why people leave in droves when a new opportunity arrives at a new company.'
column13: 'pros': 'The pay started off fine
column14: however has not kept up with current market value. In many cases you will be ~20k under market value.\n\nBonus is alright
column15: but again can\'t compete with the market.\n\nSome of the people are great and exceptional
column16: however their voice is often drowned out in the name of ""Company Culture""'
column31: 'advice': ""How this company doesn't have a class action against them is beyond me.  But here I go
column32:
writing onto to deaf ears:

- Allow us to leave your toxic company. Stop suing our potential new employers!!!!

- Fire reactive (lazy) managers
column33: especially on old projects and apps from the early/mid 2000s.\n\n- Fire some of IT Executive Admin and IT HR from top to bottom
column34: please let go of these people who play favorites. Especially in Executive admin.  And individuals in HR that makes us uncomfortable.\n\n- Allow WFH and flexibility. Uline is not our family. It's a company
column35: our real families who actually love us are at home.""
column37:
they'll try to stop you from leaving by suing your potential employers. 

Uline culture:
 - 5 days a week in office
column39:
women -> skirts even in winter)
- Women get dress checked more than men (discriminatory). 
- Quotas on promotions
- HR
column40: IT Executive Admins play favorites by enforcing rules for who they want in IT\n- HAVE to be clocked in for 9 hours a day -> 45 hour work weeks\n- PTO days count as 8 hours. For every day you take PTO you have to make up 1 hour. Penalty for taking PTO it seems. (not sure it's legal
column42:
especially for an IT and tech departments. You can work really hard and not get a promotion because of this.
- Please look at the other reviews for what Uline 'small quirks' are.

Uline says if you don't like the 'family'
column43: you can leave. But that's also a lie.\n\nAs you read above
column44: the 'quirks' that Uline has pushed many people to look elsewhere. Another company
column47: took our best developers and more. Company A offered what Uline cannot - Uline (mid-level) software developers were being interviewed & hired for Senior positions at Company A. This could have been preventable if there weren't quotas on promotions
column48: no favoritism and cultural improvements. \n\nInstead of Uline using this as opportunity to fix their culture
column49: they decided to sue! Company A had to immediately stop hiring anybody from Uline and sabotaged many careers in IT
column50: preventing them from going to the next step.\n\nBesides that
column51: Uline IT executive admin and HR are also a big part of what make it a horrible experience. They have favorites
column52: enforce rules for who they don't like and let it slide for those they do like. If you decide to leave your cube and take a mental break on a couch
column53: IT Executive Admin WILL keep track of that and use it against you
column54: and inform HR or your manager. This include personals calls
column56: etc. Want to report them? Uline hates IT and will side with managers
column58: and ITExecutive admin. This is why it's crucial to have individuals of integrity in those positions
column60: especially for IT Executive Admin that sits amongst us.""
column70: the pay is decent. But the salaries are on the lower end of the average salaries for software developers in Milwaukee

column13:
JOB DESCRIPTION

At Citadel, Software Engineers are responsible for building the systems that power every aspect of our investment process, from research and analysis to trading, risk management, funding and settlement. Working side by side with investors and quantitative researchers, we use our technical skills to drive critical commercial outcomes. If you’re interested in financial markets and excited by the prospect of having real impact in a fast-paced environment where everyone is inspired to be their best, we’re excited to meet you.

Our most successful engineers are critical thinkers who know how to dissect the problem as proficiently as they know how to build the solution. While we look for technical acumen, commercial acumen is just as important. That includes the ability to flex, change course, and iterate without always having pre-defined specs.

Citadel Engineering’s NXT Network provides a unique early career opportunity for premier software engineers, placing them on an accelerated development path and bringing together brilliant technical talent with extraordinary investment and quantitative teams. Through structured learning, mentorship, networking and engagement with senior leaders, high-performing engineers position themselves to embrace challenges, build impactful solutions, maximize their talents and build extraordinary careers.

YOUR OPPORTUNITY:
 * Design, develop, and deploy elegant software solutions across the firm
 * Partner with business leaders to define priorities and deliver custom solutions
 * Receive structured learning on technical and quantitative skills
 * Develop under the direct sponsorship of our firm’s CTO and engage with other C-level leadership


YOUR SKILLS & TALENTS:
 * 2-5 years of professional software engineering experience
 * Solid computer science fundamentals
 * Highly proficient programing skills in at least one of the following: Java, C++, Python
 * Proven track record in software design and development
 * Excellent analysis / problem solving skills
 * Strong communication and teamwork skills
 * Ability to manage multiple tasks in a demanding and dynamic environment
 * Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related STEM discipline



In accordance with New York City’s Pay Transparency Law, the base salary range for this role is $150,000 to $300,000. Base salary does not include other forms of compensation or benefits.


ABOUT CITADEL

Citadel is one of the world’s leading alternative investment managers. We manage capital on behalf of many of the world’s preeminent private, public and nonprofit institutions. We seek the highest and best use of investor capital in order to deliver market leading results and contribute to broader economic growth. For over 30 years, Citadel has cultivated a culture of learning and collaboration among some of the most talented and accomplished investment professionals, researchers and engineers in the world. Our colleagues are empowered to test their ideas and develop commercial solutions that accelerate their growth and drive real impact.
