Investing in Your Growth

  • Continuous Learning – Our dedicated learning and development team matches employees with industry experts to provide personalized skill development. Our team members are encouraged to pursue advanced degrees with company reimbursement.
  • After Hours – We host exclusive events for colleagues, friends, and family. From box seats at stadiums to theater buyouts and cooking classes, you will bond with colleagues at global and local events.
  • Nourish & Energize – Healthy foods and snacks keep our teams at peak performance.
  • On-Site Fitness Centers – Reach new levels of personal performance with access to fitness centers.
'}, 'overallBenefitRating': 4.5}, 'numReviews': 3}, 'employerContent': {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContent', 'diversityContent': {'__typename': 'DiversityAndInclusionContent', 'goals': []}, 'featuredVideoLink': '', 'managedContent': [{'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

Who we are

As one of the world’s leading alternative investment managers, we identify the highest and best uses of capital to generate superior long-term returns for the world’s preeminent public and private institutions. \xa0

Get to know Citadel \xa0

What we do

We drive capital to the world’s most impactful and compelling investments, leveraging our unmatched talent, technology, analytics and global scale. We pursue a variety of strategies to capture undiscovered market opportunities. \xa0

Discover our strategies \xa0 \xa0

Our culture

Our aim is to be the most successful investment team in the world. That’s why every member of our team helps develop and execute on powerful insights. Investment professionals, engineers and quantitative researchers come together to learn from each other and quickly build extraordinary careers. Together, we do what others consider impossible. \xa0

Meet our teams

', 'captions': None, 'id': 28842, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/14937/citadel-template-1728585609700.jpg', 'https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/14937/citadel-template-1696869272666.jpg'], 'title': 'Life at Citadel', 'type': 'TMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

Engineering

Our engineers build the systems and tools that power our business to operate in real time. They also create market-leading experiences for our clients and partners so markets function efficiently. As an engineer, you can create systems architectures, develop platforms and build web frameworks. You’ll have access to state-of-the-art tools and apply innovative techniques including distributed computing, natural language processing, machine learning and more.

Explore Engineering at Citadel

Quantitative Research

Our quantitative researchers work collaboratively to apply advanced statistical techniques and engineering acumen to model markets, test hypotheses and create trading algorithms in the world’s most competitive and dynamic markets. Our quants apply their mathematical and coding aptitude to help execute trades at scale.

Explore Quantitative Research at Citadel

Markets & Trading

Our traders make complex risk decisions and execute trades at scale, in real-time. As a markets and trading expert, you’ll use predictive analytics and advanced technology to monitor risk, respond to market signals and execute trading strategies across Options, ETFs, Equities, Fixed Income, Commodities and Currencies.

Explore Markets & Trading at Citadel

', 'captions': None, 'id': 216798, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/14937/citadel-template-1728585611096.jpg', 'https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/14937/citadel-template-1723739470093.jpg'], 'title': 'Career Paths', 'type': 'TMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

Explore our internships

An internship at Citadel is more than a job—it’s an experience. Apply your curiosity and engage in meaningful work with the brightest minds in the industry.

Over the course of 11 weeks, our interns:

  • Benefit from mentorship: Receive constructive, tailored guidance to help you learn and deliver your best.
  • Develop valuable skills: Participate in classes, seminars and coffee chats led by our industry experts.
  • Make an impact: Apply what you learn working side-by-side with our full-time early-career employees.
  • Explore the community: Experience the city with exclusive access to things like top cultural spots and sporting events.

Find out more about our Internships

View open positions

column13:
To aid in the development of full-stack web applications written in a combination of common web languages and frameworks using wireframes and work tickets, to troubleshoot and debug existing applications, and optimize applications for cross-platform applications.

We are looking for a developer who is interested in taking on projects and working with a small team to see them to completion. We develop full-stack custom solutions for our customers built on top of existing common web frameworks, then expand, support, and debug these projects as needed. Years of experience in development is not required so long as you have a strong work ethic and a willingness to learn.

Main requirements:

· JavaScript/Typescript Experience

· HTML/CSS Experience

· Strong work ethic

· Attention to detail

· An analytical and problem-solving mindset

· A focus on writing clean, well-documented code

· Must be authorized to work in the US

· Must attend daily conference call meetings on weekdays” and “must be able to communicate well while working remotely

· Must have your own computer and office space

Nice-to-haves:

· Vue3 Experience

· NoSQL database or Firebase experience

· Full-stack Development Experience

· Experience Using Git Repositories

· Experience Troubleshooting and Debugging Software

· Experience Deploying Back-end and Front-end Code to Production Servers

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $22.00 - $55.00 per hour

Expected hours: 32 – 50 per week

Benefits:

 * Flexible schedule
 * Health insurance
 * Paid time off

Compensation Package:

 * Bonus opportunities

Schedule:

 * 8 hour shift
 * Monday to Friday
 * No nights

Education:

 * High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

 * JavaScript/Typescript: 2 years (Required)
 * HTML/CSS: 2 years (Required)
 * Vue3: 1 year (Preferred)
 * NoSQL database or Firebase: 1 year (Preferred)
 * Full-stack Development: 1 year (Preferred)

Language:

 * English (Required)

Location:

 * Texas (Required)

Work Location: Remote

column13:
We are looking for proficient programmers to join our team to train our AI chatbots to code. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

As part of the application process, you will be asked to complete an assessment. If you pass, you will gain access to projects. Based on the quality of your work, you will continue to receive projects regularly. We find our most successful candidates work between 5-20 hours per week, up to 40 hours.

Benefits:

 * This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
 * You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
 * You can work on your own schedule
 * Projects are paid hourly, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities:

 * Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
 * Write high-quality answers and code snippets
 * Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications:

 * Fluency in English
 * Proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript
 * Detail-oriented
 * Excellent writing and grammar skills
 * A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)

Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you.

#INDUSSD

Job Type: Contract

Pay: From $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 1 – 40 per week

Work Location: Remote

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

As part of the application process, you will be asked to complete an assessment. If you pass, you will gain access to projects. Based on the quality of your work, you will continue to receive projects regularly. We find our most successful candidates work between 5-20 hours per week, up to 40 hours.

Benefits:

  • This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
  • You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
  • You can work on your own schedule
  • Projects are paid hourly, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities:

  • Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
  • Write high-quality answers and code snippets
  • Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications:

  • Fluency in English
  • Proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript
  • Detail-oriented
  • Excellent writing and grammar skills
  • A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)

Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you.

#INDUSSD

Job Type: Contract

Pay: From $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 1 – 40 per week

Work Location: Remote

Work from the Comfort of Your Home to Train AI. Apply Today. Get paid to train AI. Remote, flexible schedule. No Experience Required. Easy Withdrawals. Free Training. Flexible Hours.

', 'captions': None, 'id': 1048479, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/8605843/dataannotation-template-1714614139466.jpg'], 'title': 'About Us', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

Working for DataAnnotation is as simple as logging in and completing projects. We're proud to offer projects starting at $20 USD per hour, with higher hourly payments for high-quality work. The best part? The earnings are unlimited. If you qualify for our long-running projects and demonstrate high-quality work, there will be virtually unlimited work available to you. The more tasks you complete, the more you earn - it's as straightforward as that.

', 'captions': None, 'id': 1048480, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/8605843/dataannotation-template-1714614146013.jpg'], 'title': 'Earnings and Opportunities', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

At DataAnnotation, we understand that the traditional 9-to-5 work schedule doesn't work for everyone. Why should it, anyway? As our world becomes more connected, the way we work should evolve too. That's why we offer complete flexibility in our projects.

With DataAnnotation, your office is wherever you want it to be, and your work hours are whenever you want them to be. Choose your own hours and schedule every single day.

', 'captions': None, 'id': 1048481, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/8605843/dataannotation-template-1714614146830.jpg'], 'title': 'Flexibility is our Foundation', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

How much will I get paid?
Projects start at $20 USD per hour. Hourly rates increase depending on the project.\xa0

How flexible is the work?
You choose when to work, how much to work, and which projects you’d like to work on. Work is available 24/7/365.

How much work will be available to me?
If you qualify for our long-running projects and demonstrate high-quality work, there will be virtually unlimited work available to you.

What kind of data collection projects do you have?
Projects on the platform run the gamut: from survey-style work, to interacting with chatbots, to creative writing tasks, and much more. Additionally, some of our core projects allow you to take advantage of your areas of expertise or subjects that you are passionate about.

Who is this opportunity for?
While no specific background experience is necessary, we're seeking individuals who have excellent writing and critical reasoning abilities, are detail-oriented, creative, and self-motivated. Applicants are encouraged to hold a Bachelor's degree.\xa0

column13:
LEAD - SOFTWARE ENGINEER

Brand: Industrial Automation
Company: Matthews International Corporation
Line of Business: MAS Warehouse Automation
Location: Cincinnati, OH, US, 45227
Req ID: 13133


POSITION SUMMARY

The Lead - Software Engineer is responsible for designing and developing server programs for distribution center management. This role understands business and customer requirements that drive the design of the technical solutions and participate in all phases of product development lifecycle. The Lead - Software Engineer also resolves site requirement changes, and support solutions to complete designed equipment installation.


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

 * Handles complex application development.
 * Setups and configures of servers, line controllers and workstations.
 * Installs on-site systems and maintains them through testing and troubleshooting.
 * Creates and designs server table layout and coordination.
 * Coordinates aspects of server and system testing and maintains technical documentation and resources to insure proper project execution.
 * Additional duties as assigned


QUALIFICATIONS / REQUIREMENTS

 * Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related field; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
 * Advanced degree (MBA, Master’s) preferred
 * 8+ years progressive Software Engineering experience required.
 * Periodic travel either locally, nationally, and/or internationally may be required.
 * High degree of proficiency in MS Office Suite, Outlook & Internet applications.
 * Strong analytical, prioritizing, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, budgeting, project management (from conception to completion), & planning skills.
 * Strong verbal and written communication skills (including analysis, interpretation, & reasoning).
 * Solid understanding and application of mathematical concepts.
 * Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization, as well as, internal and external clients.
 * Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment.
 * Ability to work with and influence peers and management.
 * Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting.

#LI-RC2

#IND123


PHYSICAL ASPECTS / WORK ENVIRONMENT

 * Regularly required to stand; walk; sit; and talk, hear and see.
 * Occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
 * Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
 * The noise level in the work environment may be high.

 * Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions.

The Matthews Industrial Automation division of Matthews International designs, manufactures and distributes a wide range of technologies and solutions for industrial automation applications including marking and coding, and warehouse automation. Our integrated systems identify, track, control, and pick products at the highest levels of accuracy.


Our focus on innovation is leading to rapid growth in each of the solution areas we provide: product identification, warehouse automation and applied automation technologies.


At Matthews International, what makes us different is what makes us great. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Matthews International affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled.

Matthews International endeavors to make our employment website and application process accessible to all users and applicants. In doing so, Matthews International provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you have a disability and require a reasonable accommodation or assistance completing the application process, please contact a member of our Human Resource Team.



Nearest Major Market: Cincinnati

column13:
Dearman Systems is seeking a software engineer (hardware interfaces) to learn our process control software, assist in implementations of the software for clients, troubleshoot issues and device connections, and implement new features as needed.

Dearman’s process control enables operators to control field hardware devices in an orchestrated manner (from a single system) and utilize data from these devices for practical business functions (reporting, invoicing, inventory management, etc). Process control is the heart of any terminal automation system and the quality of this software code dictates the reliability of the entire system.

Must be authorized to work in the US as Dearman is unable to provide visa sponsorship at this time.

This role is not remote. Relocation to Tucson is required.

Why Dearman?

Dearman Systems is an established software company with offices in Tucson, AZ and Houston, TX. Dearman provides mission critical software solutions to the bulk liquids storage industry — a backbone of the global economy.

Founded in 1988, the Dearman name is well-known in the bulk liquids storage industry for their technical expertise and unparalleled customer support. At Dearman, the customer comes first.

About The Role

You will learn our current process control system — working closely with clients during implementations and issue resolution. This requires you to become an expert in device integration, including presets, meters, weight scales, and PLCs (or be currently familiar and become an expert on the job).

This role is in the office in Tucson, AZ. 2 remote work days per week are allowed to start with more available with increased tenure.

Key Responsibilities:

 * Learn our current process control system and become an independent expert
 * Support clients during issue resolution, keeping calm under pressure and difficult circumstances
 * Contribute to documentation
 * Become an expert on device integration, connections, and communication protocols
 * Become an expert in API (American Petroleum Institute) Standards and Certification requirements. Gain industry knowledge of the oil and gas industry
 * Become an expert in Acculoads, Microloads, Multiloads, and truck weight scales
 * Become an expert in the Dearman Data Entry Unit (DEU) gate hardware device
 * Contribute to the latest version of our process control code base. Continue to provide enhancements and upgrades over time

Qualifications:

 * C++ experience (Required)
 * Proficiency in ASP.NET and C# using the Microsoft Visual Studio IDE. If you are highly skilled in C++ and willing to learn C#, that is ok
 * Relational database experience, MS SQL Server (Required)
 * Git source control system (Required)
 * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or related discipline or related work experience
 * Creative problem solving and extreme attention to detail
 * Knowledge of Modbus and communication via serial and TCP/IP; data acquisition and control
 * Visual Basic experience is nice to have (for supporting/converting legacy systems)
 * Visual Studio 6 experience is nice to have (for supporting/converting legacy systems)
 * Knowledge of Acculoads, Multiloads, PLCs is a plus
 * Sequential state logic design

Working at Dearman:

 * Competitive salary
 * Small company with focus on employees
 * High visibility in your role with opportunity for advancement
 * 4 weeks PTO and holidays
 * Health, dental, and vision insurance
 * 401K and 401K matching

Salary for this position is based on experience.

This role is not remote. Relocation to Tucson is required.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

 * 401(k)
 * Dental insurance
 * Health insurance
 * Life insurance
 * Paid holidays
 * Paid time off
 * Vision insurance

Compensation Package:

 * Retention bonus

Schedule:

 * Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

 * Will you now, or in the future, require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g. H-1B visa status)?

Experience:

 * C++: 2 years (Required)
 * SQL: 1 year (Preferred)
 * C#: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

 * Tucson, AZ 85711: Relocate with an employer provided relocation package (Required)

Work Location: In person

'remoteWorkTypes': None, 'salarySource': None, 'savedJobId': 0, 'seoJobLink': 'https://www.glassdoor.com/job-listing/software-engineer-process-control-dearman-systems-JV_IC1133996_KO0,33_KE34,49.htm?jl=1009552875803', 'sgocId': 1007, 'sponsored': False, 'urgencySignal': None}, 'job': {'__typename': 'JobDetails', 'description': "

Dearman Systems is seeking a software engineer (hardware interfaces) to learn our process control software, assist in implementations of the software for clients, troubleshoot issues and device connections, and implement new features as needed.

Dearman’s process control enables operators to control field hardware devices in an orchestrated manner (from a single system) and utilize data from these devices for practical business functions (reporting, invoicing, inventory management, etc). Process control is the heart of any terminal automation system and the quality of this software code dictates the reliability of the entire system.

Must be authorized to work in the US as Dearman is unable to provide visa sponsorship at this time.

This role is not remote. Relocation to Tucson is required.

Why Dearman?

Dearman Systems is an established software company with offices in Tucson, AZ and Houston, TX. Dearman provides mission critical software solutions to the bulk liquids storage industry — a backbone of the global economy.

Founded in 1988, the Dearman name is well-known in the bulk liquids storage industry for their technical expertise and unparalleled customer support. At Dearman, the customer comes first.

About The Role

You will learn our current process control system — working closely with clients during implementations and issue resolution. This requires you to become an expert in device integration, including presets, meters, weight scales, and PLCs (or be currently familiar and become an expert on the job).

This role is in the office in Tucson, AZ. 2 remote work days per week are allowed to start with more available with increased tenure.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Learn our current process control system and become an independent expert
  • Support clients during issue resolution, keeping calm under pressure and difficult circumstances
  • Contribute to documentation
  • Become an expert on device integration, connections, and communication protocols
  • Become an expert in API (American Petroleum Institute) Standards and Certification requirements. Gain industry knowledge of the oil and gas industry
  • Become an expert in Acculoads, Microloads, Multiloads, and truck weight scales
  • Become an expert in the Dearman Data Entry Unit (DEU) gate hardware device
  • Contribute to the latest version of our process control code base. Continue to provide enhancements and upgrades over time

Qualifications:

  • C++ experience (Required)
  • Proficiency in ASP.NET and C# using the Microsoft Visual Studio IDE. If you are highly skilled in C++ and willing to learn C#, that is ok
  • Relational database experience, MS SQL Server (Required)
  • Git source control system (Required)
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or related discipline or related work experience
  • Creative problem solving and extreme attention to detail
  • Knowledge of Modbus and communication via serial and TCP/IP; data acquisition and control
  • Visual Basic experience is nice to have (for supporting/converting legacy systems)
  • Visual Studio 6 experience is nice to have (for supporting/converting legacy systems)
  • Knowledge of Acculoads, Multiloads, PLCs is a plus
  • Sequential state logic design

Working at Dearman:

  • Competitive salary
  • Small company with focus on employees
  • High visibility in your role with opportunity for advancement
  • 4 weeks PTO and holidays
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • 401K and 401K matching

Salary for this position is based on experience.

This role is not remote. Relocation to Tucson is required.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Life insurance
  • Paid holidays
  • Paid time off
  • Vision insurance

Compensation Package:

  • Retention bonus

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

  • Will you now, or in the future, require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g. H-1B visa status)?

Experience:

  • C++: 2 years (Required)
  • SQL: 1 year (Preferred)
  • C#: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

  • Tucson, AZ 85711: Relocate with an employer provided relocation package (Required)

Work Location: In person

column13:
The Company

PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.


We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.


We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.


Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.

Job Description Summary: 1+ years of experience developing large scale applications JAVA, Spring Core and Spring Batch, with good hands on exposure to SQL and NoSQL technologies, good understanding of relational and free form databases, including strong data architecture and SQL development skills o Exposure to Spark, Distributed Databases, Cloud Technologies is a plus. o Deep understanding of advanced object-oriented design and development principles. o Basic level understanding of designing and developing data intensive applications, and architecting them for scalability and availability.

Job Description:

 * Develops efficient, elegant, clean, reusable code with no unnecessary complication or abstraction.
 * Deliver quality solutions on schedule;
 * Works with business partners to understand the requirements and develop elegant reusable solutions/code.
 * Create / Review well-articulated, detailed low level design documents;
 * Presents issues and solutions to audiences of varying sizes. Provides recognized technical and business leadership and is able to provide deep technical support across a range of functionality.
 * Manages workload and other assignments efficiently while being able to resolve time-critical situations reliably and professionally.
 * Participates in the development of tools, systems and processes aimed at improving product supportability or overall support productivity.
 * 1+ years of experience developing large scale enterprise applications, primarily with JAVA with hands on experience in RDBMS and NoSQL databases
 * Developing high traffic backend services, with low latency and designing them for scale.
 * Experience applying software design patterns, data structures, algorithms.
 * Good analytical and problem solving skills
 * Experience in Unix based development environment is a plus
 * Knowledge on scripting languages like Unix Shell, Perl, Python is a plus.
 * Experience with unit testing using Junit.
 * Experience using industry standard software development tools (IDE / Version Control / Continuous Integration)
 * Strong debugging and problem resolution skills
 * Expertise in online payments and related domains is a plus
 * Focuses on test driven development and automation.
 * Believes in Agile development and are comfortable with SCRUM process.
 * Refactor existing codebase and in understanding existing implementations to decide to refactor or rewrite



For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.


Our Benefits:

At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.

We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com



Who We Are:

To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx



Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.

Belonging at PayPal:

Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.


Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.


We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.

'EmployerInfoVO', 'comment': '

PayPal wants our employees to feel secure in their benefits, and we support your mental, physical, and emotional balance. Best of all, you are eligible for coverage on your date of hire.

Health and Welfare

Our fulltime U.S.-based employees are eligible for a variety of medical, dental, and vision plans, as well as Short- and Long-Term Disability, Life Insurance, and Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D). Coverage choices for medical coverage will vary, depending on your US location. Dental and vision plan choices are available.

Financial Security

Your financial security is important to us, so we offer a variety of options to choose from, including 401k Savings Plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, and Flexible Spending Accounts for health care and dependent care.

Time-Off Programs

PayPal recognizes that as employees pass through various life stages, their time away needs change accordingly. We provide support through the following programs:

  • Sabbatical Program: 4 weeks of paid leave after completion of 5 years of service
  • Tracking-Free Vacation: all U.S.-based exempt employees self-manage vacation and work with supervisors to schedule time off.
  • Give Time: After one year of employment, eligible employees are paid 100% of base pay, or 8 hours/year, to volunteer at a qualifying community-based organization
  • Paid Sick Leave
  • Enhanced Maternity Benefit
  • Paid Bonding Leave within the first year of the birth or placement of a child; available to all mothers, fathers, same-sex spouses, and domestic partners
  • Paid Family Care Leave allows paid time off for employees to care for a seriously ill family member
  • Holidays: PayPal observes 10 holidays each year


Additional benefits to support your everyday living include adoption assistance, educational assistance, and employee assistance. We have the added extras too – group legal benefits, identity theft protection, and we even offer pet insurance.


'}, 'overallBenefitRating': 4.3}, 'numReviews': 3}, 'employerContent': {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContent', 'diversityContent': {'__typename': 'DiversityAndInclusionContent', 'goals': []}, 'featuredVideoLink': 'https://youtu.be/VyoiQO4VJ0s', 'managedContent': [{'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

We believe now is the time to reimagine money and democratize financial services, so that managing and moving money is safe and accessible for everyone. We’re driven by this purpose and support employees by valuing inclusion, innovation, collaboration, and wellness, so they can ensure that every person can participate in the global economy.

Headquartered in San Jose, CA, we have approximately 10,000 employees in North America, and each one is empowered to innovate constantly and to compete fiercely. If you're ready to take up our global challenge, bring your passion, experience, and vision to the team at PayPal. We are proud to work here. You will be, too.

Click here to join our Talent Community.\xa0

Working at PayPal

We champion flexibility. The majority of our roles are virtual flex or fully virtual, providing teams the opportunity to determine the amount of time spent working in-office based on business needs. A small portion of employee roles do require on-site work. We are happy to provide more details about how our working models are applied to the role(s) you are interested in, during the interview process. Click here to learn more about our locations around the world.\xa0

Your Career. Your Way.

Search jobs by category to find a position and a team where you can make an impact. Click here to learn more.

', 'captions': None, 'id': 2093, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/9848/paypal-template-1707175491725.jpg', 'https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/9848/paypal-template-1715287427738.jpg'], 'title': 'Who We Are', 'type': 'TMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

We're excited to get to know you better and share more about PayPal. Through the recruitment process, you'll learn more about our people who work here, our culture, and your benefits. Plus, we'll give you more insight into the position, the team, and your new teammates.

At PayPal, we have a robust recruitment process to help attract and hire the best people. Hopefully, that includes you! Let’s find out if we fit with your career goals and if PayPal offers you the opportunity to learn, grow, and thrive. Learn more about How We Recruit when you click here.\xa0

Learning & Development

Our approach to learning and development focuses on opportunities that create business impact, improve team performance, and enable professional career growth. In addition to self-paced learning modules, we offer career development programs that help all employees build their skillsets and\xa0advance their careers.

Built on the foundation of our four core values, PayPal’s Leadership Principles serve as a common framework that captures the essence of how we operate. They also guide our talent management strategy across the employee lifecycle.\xa0

  • Put People First\xa0is all about building the next generation by unlocking their superpowers, providing and seeking constructive feedback, and fostering belonging.
  • Work Customer Back\xa0is about starting with our customers’ greatest needs, solving them with tech and innovation, with the purpose of creating simple and valuable experiences. We know this will require meaningful change as a company, and for us as leaders of this company.
  • Win Together\xa0is about moving quickly, working as one PayPal, and delivering great end-to-end results.

Interested in learning more about our job categories? Click here.\xa0

', 'captions': None, 'id': 19985, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/9848/paypal-template-1611695831498.jpg'], 'title': 'How We Recruit', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

Building a career at PayPal, gives you a chance to make an impact on the world, by helping democratize financial services for all. You will be immersed in a vibrant culture that thrives on innovation, collaboration, inclusion and wellness. As an intern or a recent graduate at PayPal, you will have the resources and support you need, to build a successful career.

PayPal has won multiple campus awards including ranking on\xa0Universum's\xa0annual list of the Most Attractive Employers in the US, Ireland, Singapore and India, and for PayPal’s subsidiary Zettle in its home country of Sweden. In addition, we have been recognized by\xa0Prosple’s\xa0list of Top 100 fresher employers in India and\xa0RippleMatch’s Campus Forward Award. Are you ready to join us?

Internships
Our internship program provides students with the opportunity for professional and personal development through a robust curriculum. Our interns work on meaningful projects that directly support PayPal’s business and customer needs, while building a strong network and community with their peers and global leadership team.

Recent College Graduates (RCGs)
We are excited to introduce PayPal’s Global Recent Graduate Learning Experience & Certification Program! In alignment with our commitment to Build the Next Generation and Learn Every Day, PayPal University Programs and Enterprise Learning & Development have partnered to develop this comprehensive program tailored exclusively for recent grads. Our Recent Graduate Learning Experience and Certification program is a unique program crafted to equip Recent Grads at PayPal with the essential skills and resources necessary to excel in their careers. This is a 2-year program focused on foundational knowledge & skills via Recommended Learning modules.

Click here to learn more about PayPal University Hiring.

', 'captions': None, 'id': 42154, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/9848/paypal-template-1715286509822.jpg', 'https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/9848/paypal-template-1715286510502.jpg'], 'title': 'University Hiring', 'type': 'TMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

We are revolutionizing commerce globally. With this mission as our North Star, we are aligned around one central vision: to make sending and receiving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure. Our values are the foundation for how we conduct business every day.

Belonging at PayPal

Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.

Transparent Reporting

Building an inclusive workforce that is representative of the businesses, consumers, and communities we serve is a key component of our long-term Belonging strategy. Our representation data provides transparency on our efforts and informs the program and benefit enhancements for our employees. We are committed to regularly evaluating our workforce representation disclosures and providing transparent reporting on our workforce demographics, including publicly releasing our\xa0U.S. EEO-1 reports.

Click here to learn more about PayPal's Mission and Values.\xa0

', 'captions': None, 'id': 19986, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/9848/paypal-template-1715286504570.jpg'], 'title': 'Mission & Values', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

Our employees are central to advancing our mission to revolutionize commerce and create value for our stakeholders. We believe that investing in our global workforce is crucial for the sustained success of our business and strive to continue fostering a workplace that serves and empowers all our people to do the best work of their lives.

Culture of Belonging

At PayPal, we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment that cultivates belonging and enables all employees to thrive as their authentic selves, driving collaboration and innovation as we develop products and services to meet the needs of our diverse customer base.

We encourage and develop strong communities that bring people together in fulfilling ways. Our eight Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) serve a critical role in nurturing a sense of community and belonging, supporting talent recruitment and retention, and furthering our Belonging strategy. They also create opportunities for employees to make deeper connections across our global network. We are continuing to evolve our ERGs to support our business initiatives, while fostering a culture of belonging.

Click here to learn more about PayPal's employees and culture.\xa0

'JobDetails', 'description': "

The Company

PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.


We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.


We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.


Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.

Job Description Summary: 1+ years of experience developing large scale applications JAVA, Spring Core and Spring Batch, with good hands on exposure to SQL and NoSQL technologies, good understanding of relational and free form databases, including strong data architecture and SQL development skills o Exposure to Spark, Distributed Databases, Cloud Technologies is a plus. o Deep understanding of advanced object-oriented design and development principles. o Basic level understanding of designing and developing data intensive applications, and architecting them for scalability and availability.

Job Description:

  • Develops efficient, elegant, clean, reusable code with no unnecessary complication or abstraction.
  • Deliver quality solutions on schedule;
  • Works with business partners to understand the requirements and develop elegant reusable solutions/code.
  • Create / Review well-articulated, detailed low level design documents;
  • Presents issues and solutions to audiences of varying sizes. Provides recognized technical and business leadership and is able to provide deep technical support across a range of functionality.
  • Manages workload and other assignments efficiently while being able to resolve time-critical situations reliably and professionally.
  • Participates in the development of tools, systems and processes aimed at improving product supportability or overall support productivity.
  • 1+ years of experience developing large scale enterprise applications, primarily with JAVA with hands on experience in RDBMS and NoSQL databases
  • Developing high traffic backend services, with low latency and designing them for scale.
  • Experience applying software design patterns, data structures, algorithms.
  • Good analytical and problem solving skills
  • Experience in Unix based development environment is a plus
  • Knowledge on scripting languages like Unix Shell, Perl, Python is a plus.
  • Experience with unit testing using Junit.
  • Experience using industry standard software development tools (IDE / Version Control / Continuous Integration)
  • Strong debugging and problem resolution skills
  • Expertise in online payments and related domains is a plus
  • Focuses on test driven development and automation.
  • Believes in Agile development and are comfortable with SCRUM process.
  • Refactor existing codebase and in understanding existing implementations to decide to refactor or rewrite

For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.


Our Benefits:

At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.

We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com


Who We Are:

To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx


Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.

Belonging at PayPal:

Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.


Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.


We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.

column13:
AT NORTHWESTERN MUTUAL, WE ARE STRONG, INNOVATIVE AND GROWING. WE INVEST IN OUR PEOPLE. WE CARE AND MAKE A POSITIVE DIFFERENCE.

On our team you will apply engineering standard methodologies to analyze, design, develop, deploy, and support data and software solutions, and/or infrastructure implementations/upgrades. To excel in this role, you need to be passionate about data and software craftmanship and eager to understand the insurance business. You should be comfortable maintaining applications with established code bases and willing to explore modern approaches to tackle new challenges.



The Actuarial Software Engineering team at Northwestern Mutual is responsible for creating and improving systems that ensure the company can meet its financial obligations to its customers, employees, and field representatives. These systems are financial in nature, centered on risk products and benefit plans, and based on the professional knowledge of the actuary. The applications are varied, generally are mathematical, and involve working in close partnerships with technical peers and actuarial business experts. The assignment will be on a team developing data solutions to perform studies on our products & policyholders and run financial projections. You’ll be part of a team that plays a crucial role in ensuring this great company continues to do great things for its customers.



Primary Duties & Responsibilities

 * Applies engineering best practices to analyze and develop data and software solutions.
 * Develops software using established development and continuous integration practices.
 * Utilizes established monitoring and automation processes.
 * Conducts code evaluations.
 * Participates in setting team standards and best practices.



Qualifications

 * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics or equivalent professional experience
 * 0-2 years professional experience in SQL, C++, C#, DAX, Object Oriented design patterns
 * Flexibility to work on the Mainframe, including PL/1 and JCL
 * Familiarity with AWS cloud and associated technologies
 * Familiarity using continuous integration and deployment concepts
 * Familiarity with both Batch and Real-time application patterns
 * Strong technical skills with a continuous growth mindset and the desire to learn
 * Interested in understanding the insurance business
 * Able to mentor new team members
 * Can communicate clearly to the business



Skills-Proficiency Level

Agile Methodologies - Basic

Automation Processes - Basic

Cloud Technologies - Basic

Code Analysis - Intermediate

Containerization - Basic

Continuous Integrations - Basic

Continuous Learning – Basic

Data Technologies - Intermediate

Deployment Strategies - Basic

Engineering Practices - Intermediate

Production Monitoring - Basic

Programming Languages - Intermediate

Root Cause Analysis - Basic

Software Development - Intermediate

System Architecture - Basic

Technical Communication - Basic

Technical Design Documentation - Basic

column14:
At Northwestern Mutual, we are strong, innovative and growing. We invest in our people. We care and make a positive difference.

On our team you will apply engineering standard methodologies to analyze, design, develop, deploy, and support data and software solutions, and/or infrastructure implementations/upgrades. To excel in this role, you need to be passionate about data and software craftmanship and eager to understand the insurance business. You should be comfortable maintaining applications with established code bases and willing to explore modern approaches to tackle new challenges.

The Actuarial Software Engineering team at Northwestern Mutual is responsible for creating and improving systems that ensure the company can meet its financial obligations to its customers, employees, and field representatives. These systems are financial in nature, centered on risk products and benefit plans, and based on the professional knowledge of the actuary. The applications are varied, generally are mathematical, and involve working in close partnerships with technical peers and actuarial business experts. The assignment will be on a team developing data solutions to perform studies on our products & policyholders and run financial projections. You’ll be part of a team that plays a crucial role in ensuring this great company continues to do great things for its customers.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities

  • Applies engineering best practices to analyze and develop data and software solutions.
  • Develops software using established development and continuous integration practices.
  • Utilizes established monitoring and automation processes.
  • Conducts code evaluations.
  • Participates in setting team standards and best practices.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics or equivalent professional experience
  • 0-2 years professional experience in SQL, C++, C#, DAX, Object Oriented design patterns
  • Flexibility to work on the Mainframe, including PL/1 and JCL
  • Familiarity with AWS cloud and associated technologies
  • Familiarity using continuous integration and deployment concepts
  • Familiarity with both Batch and Real-time application patterns
  • Strong technical skills with a continuous growth mindset and the desire to learn
  • Interested in understanding the insurance business
  • Able to mentor new team members
  • Can communicate clearly to the business

Skills-Proficiency Level

Agile Methodologies - Basic

Automation Processes - Basic

Cloud Technologies - Basic

Code Analysis - Intermediate

Containerization - Basic

Continuous Integrations - Basic

Continuous Learning – Basic

Data Technologies - Intermediate

Deployment Strategies - Basic

Engineering Practices - Intermediate

Production Monitoring - Basic

Programming Languages - Intermediate

Root Cause Analysis - Basic

Software Development - Intermediate

System Architecture - Basic

Technical Communication - Basic

Technical Design Documentation - Basic

Technical Solution Development - Basic

Compensation Range:

Pay Range - Start:

$63,560.00

Pay Range - End:

$118,040.00

Northwestern Mutual pays on a geographic-specific salary structure and placement in the salary range for this position will be determined by a number of factors including the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; the scope, complexity as well as the cost of labor in the market; and other conditions of employment. We offer a competitive corporate benefits package that includes:  

  • Competitive base salary 
  • Performance-based incentive pay opportunity 
  • Medical, dental and vision insurance 
  • Life insurance, survivor and disability protection 
  • Cash Balance/Pension plan 
  • 401(k) plan 
  • Flexible paid time off and volunteer time 
  • Parental leave and caregiver time off programs 
  • Career development resources and training 
  • Educational assistance program 
  • Employee assistance program 
  • Adoption/surrogacy assistance 
  • Health management programs and resources 
  • On-site medical centers (Wisconsin and New York campuses) 
  • On-site fitness centers open 24/7 (Wisconsin campuses) 
  • Fitness reimbursement (New York and remote employees) 

We offer all of that, plus a modern, comfortable workplace where you can bring your best. It all adds up to a great place to work and an employee experience that sets us apart. 

'}, 'overallBenefitRating': 3.5}, 'numReviews': 3}, 'employerContent': {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContent', 'diversityContent': {'__typename': 'DiversityAndInclusionContent', 'goals': []}, 'featuredVideoLink': 'https://youtu.be/7SlQuS7AOgQ?list=PL7u7mvVIEKJB03cWs9GujFpzcbjEtCIEm', 'managedContent': [{'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

As achieving financial security becomes more complex for people, a few simple truths are\xa0becoming even more powerful. Relationships are built on trust. Our lives and businesses matter. \xa0And we’re much stronger together than we are apart. These beliefs launched our company more than 165 years ago. Today they’re hardwired into our DNA and are just some of the reasons why people\xa0turn to Northwestern Mutual to help secure their financial lives. \xa0Why are we so passionate about helping people achieve financial security? To start with, it’s not\xa0about profits. As a mutual company, we don’t have stockholders. It’s because we love building\xa0brighter futures for our more than four million clients, financial representatives, employees and\xa0communities. We do it unlike anybody else. \xa0We believe in doing what’s right. This is evident in the way we do business, in how we work with\xa0clients, in the values we hold and in the way we’re working together to strengthen local\xa0communities.\xa0

  • Recent Awards and Accolades:\xa0
  • FORTUNE® 111 (FORTUNE® 500, 2023)\xa0
  • One of the “World’s Most Admired” life insurance companies (FORTUNE® Magazine, 2022)\xa0
  • Best Places to Work #82 (Glassdoor, 2021)\xa0
  • Best Places to Work #88 (BuiltIn, 2024)\xa0
  • Best Employers for Diversity (Forbes, 2018-2023)\xa0
  • Best Employers for Women (Forbes, 2023)\xa0
  • Best Places to Work – 100% Corporate Equality Index (Human Rights Campaign, 2018-2023)\xa0
  • America’s Best Large Employers (Forbes 2023)\xa0
  • Top 50 “Best-of-the-Best” Corporations for Inclusion (National Business Inclusion, 2022-2023)\xa0
  • Eight Employee Resource Groups Ranked Top 25 Nationwide (Association of ERGs and Councils, 2021-2022)\xa0
  • Military Friendly® Employer (2020-2023)\xa0
  • Best Companies for Diversity (Black Enterprise, 2023)\xa0
  • 100% Score (Disability Equality Index, 2019-2023)\xa0
', 'captions': ['Employee in Meeting'], 'id': 34779, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/2919/northwestern-mutual-template-1709571685368.jpg'], 'title': 'Our Story', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

With Northwestern Mutual, you get the benefits of a big company with a progressive culture you might not expect. We believe in hiring smart people and then listening to them. Northwestern Mutual employees have chosen to work somewhere they can be proud of. We're proud to listen to them and learn from them as we build the future together.\xa0

We also believe in keeping our talent here. Which is why career growth is a cornerstone. When it comes to growing your career, there’s not one right path. It can mean developing in place and diversifying your skills. It can also mean expanding your responsibilities, moving up, or even changing tracks entirely. No matter where you are on your career journey, we support your growth with opportunities, resources, and people who are on your side.\xa0\xa0

', 'captions': ['Work somewhere you can be proud of'], 'id': 34780, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/2919/northwestern-mutual-template-1707407096764.jpg'], 'title': 'Corp Careers', 'type': 'TMEDIA', 'videos': ['']}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

At Northwestern Mutual, our interns do meaningful work and learn every single day. We offer hands-on experience through teamwork and collaboration, as well as individual work assignments.\xa0\xa0

And whatever you’re studying, we have an opportunity for you. From tech and design to finance and corporate roles, there is something for everyone. Our interns participate in a wide range of learning and development activities including job shadows, attending various speaking engagements and events designed to expose interns to other areas of our business.\xa0

Your career starts here.

', 'captions': ['Build your future here', 'Intern working'], 'id': 34781, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/2919/northwestern-mutual-template-1707407098399.jpg', 'https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/2919/northwestern-mutual-template-1707407099126.jpg'], 'title': 'Corp Internship', 'type': 'TMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

With opportunities ranging from Engineering to Cybersecurity and from Data and Analytics to Enterprise Architecture, Northwestern Mutual is working to change the game. Grow your career alongside curious, ambitious, innovative talent. Our tech teams deliver simplified digital experiences for our clients and advisors.\xa0

Whether it’s a new app, financial planning, or insurance products, our engineers are creating digital products that help our clients and advisors every day. Get what you need to feel fulfilled in a collaborative environment where you can contribute, grow, and evolve as a professional. To build a business that has excelled for more than 165 years, we’ve had to keep changing, growing, and iterating.\xa0\xa0

Join us to build creative ways to make finance accessible anywhere.\xa0

', 'captions': ['Big tech, without the big tech grind'], 'id': 35506, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/2919/northwestern-mutual-template-1707407099815.jpg'], 'title': 'Tech and Innovation', 'type': 'TMEDIA', 'videos': ['']}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

A financial representative career with Northwester Mutual not only allows you to grow personally and professionally. It gives your work a sense of purpose – the chance to make the most of your skills and talents while helping others. It’s a unique opportunity to be your own boss while also making a difference for others.\xa0\xa0

When you work with Northwestern Mutual as a financial representative, we empower you to empower others. That’s why we provide you with the tools and solutions you need to help your clients’ reach their financial goals:\xa0\xa0\xa0

  • Exclusive access to our risk products and proven planning solutions—from life insurance, disability income insurance, and education funding options to retirement planning, estate planning, and business planning.\xa0\xa0
  • The opportunity to offer services that have been helping clients achieve financial security for more than 165 years—one with strength, values, and a track record of diversity and inclusion.\xa0\xa0

Learn more and apply to be a financial representative.\xa0

column13:
We are looking for proficient programmers to join our team to train our AI chatbots to code. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

As part of the application process, you will be asked to complete an assessment. If you pass, you will gain access to projects. Based on the quality of your work, you will continue to receive projects regularly. We find our most successful candidates work between 5-20 hours per week, up to 40 hours.

Benefits:

 * This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
 * You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
 * You can work on your own schedule
 * Projects are paid hourly, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities:

 * Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
 * Write high-quality answers and code snippets
 * Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications:

 * Fluency in English
 * Proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript
 * Detail-oriented
 * Excellent writing and grammar skills
 * A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)

Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you.

#INDUSSD

Job Type: Contract

Pay: From $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 1 – 40 per week

Work Location: Remote

Work from the Comfort of Your Home to Train AI. Apply Today. Get paid to train AI. Remote, flexible schedule. No Experience Required. Easy Withdrawals. Free Training. Flexible Hours.

', 'captions': None, 'id': 1048479, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/8605843/dataannotation-template-1714614139466.jpg'], 'title': 'About Us', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

Working for DataAnnotation is as simple as logging in and completing projects. We're proud to offer projects starting at $20 USD per hour, with higher hourly payments for high-quality work. The best part? The earnings are unlimited. If you qualify for our long-running projects and demonstrate high-quality work, there will be virtually unlimited work available to you. The more tasks you complete, the more you earn - it's as straightforward as that.

', 'captions': None, 'id': 1048480, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/8605843/dataannotation-template-1714614146013.jpg'], 'title': 'Earnings and Opportunities', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

At DataAnnotation, we understand that the traditional 9-to-5 work schedule doesn't work for everyone. Why should it, anyway? As our world becomes more connected, the way we work should evolve too. That's why we offer complete flexibility in our projects.

With DataAnnotation, your office is wherever you want it to be, and your work hours are whenever you want them to be. Choose your own hours and schedule every single day.

', 'captions': None, 'id': 1048481, 'photos': ['https://media.glassdoor.com/template/l/8605843/dataannotation-template-1714614146830.jpg'], 'title': 'Flexibility is our Foundation', 'type': 'OMEDIA', 'videos': None}, {'__typename': 'EmployerManagedContentSection', 'body': '

How much will I get paid?
Projects start at $20 USD per hour. Hourly rates increase depending on the project.\xa0

How flexible is the work?
You choose when to work, how much to work, and which projects you’d like to work on. Work is available 24/7/365.

How much work will be available to me?
If you qualify for our long-running projects and demonstrate high-quality work, there will be virtually unlimited work available to you.

What kind of data collection projects do you have?
Projects on the platform run the gamut: from survey-style work, to interacting with chatbots, to creative writing tasks, and much more. Additionally, some of our core projects allow you to take advantage of your areas of expertise or subjects that you are passionate about.

Who is this opportunity for?
While no specific background experience is necessary, we're seeking individuals who have excellent writing and critical reasoning abilities, are detail-oriented, creative, and self-motivated. Applicants are encouraged to hold a Bachelor's degree.\xa0

'https://www.glassdoor.com/job-listing/enterprise-software-developer-ai-trainer-dataannotation-JV_KO0,40_KE41,55.htm?jl=1009542156905', 'sgocId': 1007, 'sponsored': True, 'urgencySignal': None}, 'job': {'__typename': 'JobDetails', 'description': "

We are looking for proficient programmers to join our team to train our AI chatbots to code. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

As part of the application process, you will be asked to complete an assessment. If you pass, you will gain access to projects. Based on the quality of your work, you will continue to receive projects regularly. We find our most successful candidates work between 5-20 hours per week, up to 40 hours.

Benefits:

  • This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
  • You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
  • You can work on your own schedule
  • Projects are paid hourly, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities:

  • Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
  • Write high-quality answers and code snippets
  • Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications:

  • Fluency in English
  • Proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript
  • Detail-oriented
  • Excellent writing and grammar skills
  • A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)

Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you.

#INDUSSD

Job Type: Contract

Pay: From $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 1 – 40 per week

Work Location: Remote
